2020-06-18.abstract: The ugly story didn’t end with the abolition of slavery.
2020-06-18.snippet: The ugly story didn’t end with the abolition of slavery.
2020-06-18.lead_paragraph: When Trump campaign officials scheduled a rally in Tulsa, Okla., on June 19, they sent what looked like a signal of approval to white supremacists. For June 19 is Juneteenth, a day celebrated by African-Americans to mark the end of slavery. And Tulsa was the site of the 1921 race massacre, one of the deadliest incidents in the long, violent offensive to deny blacks the fruits of their hard-won freedom.
2020-06-18.headline_main: Tulsa and the Many Sins of Racism

2020-06-18.abstract: A guide to trimming, tweezing and touching up your arches on your own, with some creative direction from the experts.
2020-06-18.snippet: A guide to trimming, tweezing and touching up your arches on your own, with some creative direction from the experts.
2020-06-18.lead_paragraph: Eyebrows have been a subject of obsession for centuries. During the Tang dynasty in China, women painted their brows to resemble the wings of butterflies, and in the Middle Ages, Europeans plucked every last hair to achieve what was considered a youthful-looking bare forehead. Our arches are no less important today and indeed seem to have become newly conspicuous during the past several months, exposed above our face masks or reflected back at us during Zoom calls. “I consider eyebrow grooming to be an art, and there are many ways of going about it,” says Jimena Garcia, a brow sculptor and specialist at Atelier Beauté Chanel in New York City, who, along with many others in her field, has started offering virtual consultations for clients. But no matter how advanced your instruction, fine-tuning your brows at home requires a bit of firsthand experience — and restraint (the temptation to over-pluck is the greatest challenge, Garcia cautions). In the end, the result should be both an expression of your personal style and a shape that best complements your features, she says. Here, an expert guide to brow pruning.
2020-06-18.headline_main: How to Shape Your Eyebrows at Home

2020-06-18.abstract: In 1865, formerly enslaved people were promised 40 acres of land and, later, a mule. More than 150 years since then some politicians are trying to make good on a version of that promise.
2020-06-18.snippet: In 1865, formerly enslaved people were promised 40 acres of land and, later, a mule. More than 150 years since then some politicians are trying to make good on a version of that promise.
2020-06-18.lead_paragraph: When Shaniyat Chowdhury, a Democratic candidate for Congress in New York, was asked about the most urgent concern facing his district, his options were not in short supply. He could have said housing or hunger. Healthcare was certainly on the table. But when prompted in a local news interview to name what he intends to do about his “single most pressing issue,” the 28-year-old democratic socialist had this answer: reparations, to address centuries of racial injustice.
2020-06-18.headline_main: How Reparations for Slavery Became a 2020 Campaign Issue

2020-06-18.abstract: Ayanna Pressley and Harriet Tubman both used naming in a way to evoke power.
2020-06-18.snippet: Ayanna Pressley and Harriet Tubman both used naming in a way to evoke power.
2020-06-18.lead_paragraph: “SoJo,” the cat of Representative Ayanna Pressley, Democrat of Massachusetts, is a celebrity in her own right. SoJo is a minor Twitter influencer; her appearance there wins likes and replies that include snapshots of admirers’ cats. Her popularity reflects how social media tastes lean toward cute pet clips and also speaks to me as a historian of black women’s politics. As Ms. Pressley explained, “SoJo” is short for Sojourner Truth Pressley Harris. Yes, Ms. Pressley’s pet carries the name of Sojourner Truth, one of early America’s best remembered African-American antislavery and women’s rights activists.
2020-06-18.headline_main: Ida, Maya, Rosa, Harriet: The Power in Our Names

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: LA FORZA DEL DESTINO Stream on Metopera.org. The venerable soprano Leontyne Price stars in this 1984 Metropolitan Opera production of Verdi’s “La Forza del Destino,” a somber tragedy set in 18th-century Spain and Italy. This production is near the end of Price’s Met career — she retired from opera the following year — and in a review for The New York Times, Will Crutchfield wrote that her “low notes have lost focus, the high ones strength and vibrancy.” But, he added, “In between she has preserved to an extraordinary degree the core of beauty that made her unique. With a broad lyrical line she can still bring tears to the eyes.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: What’s on TV Friday: ‘La Forza Del Destino’ and ‘Ann’

But to truly recognize one’s place in the cultural landscape, she says, it’s necessary to learn about the broader history of transgender representation onscreen.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The first sound I heard on the phone was heavy, harsh breathing. Then the stranger introduced himself to me. “You don’t know me but my name is Sidney Moss … and I’m your father,” he said.

2020-06-19.abstract: Cheesy games, taco nights and at-home spa moments are just a few ways that the reality stars are keeping busy, along with some serious discussions about race and current news events.
2020-06-19.snippet: Cheesy games, taco nights and at-home spa moments are just a few ways that the reality stars are keeping busy, along with some serious discussions about race and current news events.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Most of us have come to expect reality television stars to be anything but real. Yet Lauren Speed, 34, and Cameron Hamilton, 29, Atlanta-based newlyweds who became breakout stars on the hit Netflix dating show, “Love Is Blind,” have proven to be the real deal. Since their TV debut earlier this year, where they got engaged sight unseen, the couple have become YouTubers, producing content for their show, Hanging with the Hamiltons, which has more than 600,000 subscribers. In recent weeks,  Ms. Speed, a digital content creator and former model, and Mr. Hamilton, a fireman turned artificial intelligence professional, have had to tackle tough conversations about racism, while also navigating the obstacles that come with being an interracial couple.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Love Is Still Blind — and Lauren and Cameron Aren’t Afraid of Tough Conversations

2020-06-19.abstract: The mystery surrounding what happened to Pfc. Vanessa Guillen, 20, has drawn widespread attention.

2020-06-19.abstract: A review of publicly available data in three areas reveals that much of an officer’s job revolves around handling routine calls rather than violent crime.
2020-06-19.snippet: A review of publicly available data in three areas reveals that much of an officer’s job revolves around handling routine calls rather than violent crime.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: What share of policing is devoted to handling violent crime? Perhaps not as much as you might think. A handful of cities post data online showing how their police departments spend their time. The share devoted to handling violent crime is very small, about 4 percent.
2020-06-19.headline_main: How Do the Police Actually Spend Their Time?

2020-06-19.abstract: Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert have weighed in on the contenders for the 152nd Belmont Stakes on Saturday.
2020-06-19.snippet: Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert have weighed in on the contenders for the 152nd Belmont Stakes on Saturday.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Because of the coronavirus pandemic, which forced organizers to move the Kentucky Derby from May 2 to Sept. 5 and the Preakness from May 16 to Oct. 3, the Belmont Stakes will kick off the Triple Crown series for the first time. The 152nd running of the race, originally scheduled for June 6, has been shortened from a mile and a half to a mile and an eighth. There will be no spectators or owners in attendance on Saturday.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Belmont Stakes Experts’ Picks: Who Will Win?

2020-06-19.abstract: The incredible tale of the brawl at the Copacabana, the racist taunts that started it and a few unlikely heroes.
2020-06-19.snippet: The incredible tale of the brawl at the Copacabana, the racist taunts that started it and a few unlikely heroes.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Joey Silvestri didn’t see all those Yankees file into the Copacabana that night. There were six of them, including Mickey Mantle, Yogi Berra, Whitey Ford, and Hank Bauer, plus their wives, all out celebrating Billy Martin’s 29th birthday. It was their third stop of the evening, and they were already well on their way to sloshed.
2020-06-19.headline_main: 63 Years Later, a Confession in a Legendary Yankees Scandal

2020-06-19.abstract: He says Trump cheered Chinese concentration camps.

2020-06-19.headline_main: Don’t Buy John Bolton’s Book. But Don’t Ignore Its Revelations.

2020-06-19.abstract: We can’t tinker around the edges. We need to dismantle systems.
2020-06-19.snippet: We can’t tinker around the edges. We need to dismantle systems.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Since the casual killing of George Floyd on camera, unprecedented protests — not policy papers — have radically shifted public opinion in support of the battle against systemic racism. The new nation being born in our streets may yet blossom into Langston Hughes’s “land that never has been yet / and yet must be” — but only if this movement refuses to let its truths be marched into the narrow cul-de-sac of “police reform.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: What the Courage to Change History Looks Like

2020-06-19.abstract: Though every part of the state is in Phase 4, New York City has been subject to additional restrictions. Here is our best attempt to explain what it all means.
2020-06-19.snippet: Though every part of the state is in Phase 4, New York City has been subject to additional restrictions. Here is our best attempt to explain what it all means.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: After New York implemented blanket shutdown orders in March that closed stores, shuttered offices and curtailed business at restaurants and bars, state officials set up a gradual process to restart the state’s economy and ease restrictions.

2020-06-19.snippet: Sridhar Ramaswamy once ran Google’s $115 billion advertising arm. But he grew disillusioned and worried that growth was too much of a priority.

2020-06-19.abstract: There is a significant difference between the community policing taught in the Minneapolis Police Academy and the ethos of some veteran officers.
2020-06-19.snippet: There is a significant difference between the community policing taught in the Minneapolis Police Academy and the ethos of some veteran officers.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — Even as the Minneapolis Police Department reels in the aftermath of its officers’ involvement in the killing of George Floyd, the department has been recruiting a new crop of trainees who will face the same challenge of every rookie: navigating the dramatic difference between what is preached at the academy and what is practiced on the street.
2020-06-19.headline_main: In Minneapolis, Looking for Police Recruits Who Can Resist Warrior Culture

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The change was as sudden as it was baffling. For some reason, Par Puzzles — an 88-year-old boutique operation on Long Island that sold handcrafted jigsaw puzzles for as much as $4,500 — was doing big business.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Soaring Sales for $4,500 Puzzles? In a Lockdown, It All Fits

2020-06-19.abstract: Companies and sports teams are trying to correct America’s painful history of overtly hurtful advertising. But not all.
2020-06-19.snippet: Companies and sports teams are trying to correct America’s painful history of overtly hurtful advertising. But not all.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Three years ago, the Supreme Court handed an Asian rock band named the Slants an unimaginable win when it proclaimed, in Matal v. Tam, that it was unconstitutional for the law to ban trademarks that were “disparaging.” In celebrating the band’s victory, the lead singer Simon Tam declared the case “a win for all marginalized groups,” asserting: “It can’t be a win for free speech if some people benefit and others don’t.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: Aunt Jemima Is Gone. Can We Finally End All Racist Branding?

2020-06-19.snippet: When the original video game was transcendental, can a sequel top it? Two Times reporters debate the answer.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Hardcore gamers and post-apocalyptica enthusiasts have waited years for a sequel to The Last of Us, an immersive video game set in a dark, dismal future after a fungus ravaged Earth and zombies have become the ruling class. The game unspooled through the lens of two unlikely companions: a hardened, Texan smuggler named Joel and a 14-year-old, streetwise girl named Ellie.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Two Gamers Played ‘The Last of Us Part II.’ They Were Blown Away.

2020-06-19.abstract: Nita Lowey’s decision to step down after three decades has created a seven-way free-for-all in Tuesday’s Democratic primary.
2020-06-19.snippet: Nita Lowey’s decision to step down after three decades has created a seven-way free-for-all in Tuesday’s Democratic primary.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: In the suburban enclaves just north of New York City, a seven-way race to replace a retiring matriarch in the House of Representatives has devolved into something far less idyllic: a venomous fight between the son of a pharmaceutical billionaire and rivals who accuse him of trying to use his wealth to buy political power.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Can a Billionaire’s Son Spend His Way to a House Seat in New York?

2020-06-19.abstract: The outcome of the company’s latest scuffle could have a lasting impact on the power dynamic between Big Tech and the rest of us.
2020-06-19.snippet: The outcome of the company’s latest scuffle could have a lasting impact on the power dynamic between Big Tech and the rest of us.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The tech faceplant of the week goes to Mark Zuckerberg, the Facebook chief executive, who recently released a video in which he and his wife said they were “deeply shaken and disgusted by President Trump’s divisive and incendiary rhetoric at a time when our nation so desperately needs unity.” It was a case study in how not to read the room, especially when you are in charge of a huge service that has been one of the main digital tools that has helped the president divide and set fire to the body politic.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Is It Finally Hammer Time for Apple and Its App Store?

2020-06-19.abstract: The shift, quietly disclosed on a government website, highlights how the Trump administration is favoring development of vaccines over treatments for the sickest patients.
2020-06-19.snippet: The shift, quietly disclosed on a government website, highlights how the Trump administration is favoring development of vaccines over treatments for the sickest patients.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: When the coronavirus kills, it attacks the lungs, filling them with fluid and robbing the body of oxygen. In chest X-rays, clear lungs turn white, a sign of how dangerously sick patients are.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Coronavirus Attacks the Lungs. A Federal Agency Just Halted Funding for New Lung Treatments.

2020-06-19.abstract: My father and I worked for years at a factory that became a Superfund hazardous-waste site. We’re still feeling the repercussions.
2020-06-19.snippet: My father and I worked for years at a factory that became a Superfund hazardous-waste site. We’re still feeling the repercussions.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: My father is dying, besieged by both emphysema and a metastatic colon cancer that’s migrated to his lungs. I shudder in recognition because I’ve nearly been killed twice by raging diseases: An unusually aggressive prostate cancer, and an uncontrollable ulcerative colitis.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Toxic Ghosts

2020-06-19.abstract: Set in a violent, tribal, pandemic-ravaged world, the long-awaited Naughty Dog epic will leave you damaged — and awed.
2020-06-19.snippet: Set in a violent, tribal, pandemic-ravaged world, the long-awaited Naughty Dog epic will leave you damaged — and awed.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: At the climax of The Last of Us, a blockbuster 2013 video game that is superficially about a zombie-fungus apocalypse but is really about the lengths a parent will go to protect a child, you are forced to kill a doctor. This doctor is not a threat. He stands there limply, holding a scalpel, so technically he’s not unarmed — but you’ve got a gun and the gameplay has made it clear, after hours of close fighting, that your character could subdue the man peacefully if he wanted.
2020-06-19.headline_main: ‘The Last of Us Part II’ Is a Dark Game for a Dark Time

2020-06-19.abstract: “Forced disappearances” are playing a critical role in the Venezuelan government’s efforts to muzzle opponents and instill fear, according to a new report.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: A crush of Venezuelan government agents entered the home brandishing guns but not a warrant, and took Ariana Granadillo away. Over the next week, they confined, beat, interrogated and nearly suffocated her, then let her go as abruptly as they had taken her in.

Their mutual friend, who Mr. Feller knew from high school, and Ms. Weir knew from Bard College, from which she graduated, introduced them earlier that day before they all got on the subway in Bushwick, Brooklyn.

2020-06-19.abstract: Deborah Beck and Alan Greenberg met in 2011 at his annual Hanukkah party. Slowly, date after date, they became a couple.
2020-06-19.snippet: Deborah Beck and Alan Greenberg met in 2011 at his annual Hanukkah party. Slowly, date after date, they became a couple.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: A peculiar alchemy of latkes, Dante, smarts and social aptitude brought Deborah Beck and Alan Greenberg together. But it took some time.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Latkes and Dante Led to Love

2020-06-19.abstract: The city of Beijing has tested 1.1 million people in less than a week and has halted many flights, but has not imposed the citywide lockdowns used in provincial outbreaks.
2020-06-19.snippet: The city of Beijing has tested 1.1 million people in less than a week and has halted many flights, but has not imposed the citywide lockdowns used in provincial outbreaks.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: At an apartment complex in southern Beijing that is under lockdown, residents could not leave their homes in a gated cluster of low-rise brick buildings. Uniformed security guards and medical workers in protective gear watched the gate.
2020-06-19.headline_main: In This Coronavirus Wave, China Tries Something New: Restraint

2020-06-19.abstract: Martin Lee, 82, has dedicated his life to bringing democracy to the Chinese territory while working within the system. Now he is under fire from both sides.
2020-06-19.snippet: Martin Lee, 82, has dedicated his life to bringing democracy to the Chinese territory while working within the system. Now he is under fire from both sides.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — He was once the most popular politician in Hong Kong, known by many as the “father of democracy.” He helped write the mini-Constitution that enshrined the city’s prized freedoms that mainland China lacks. For nearly four decades, he provoked Beijing by crusading for civil liberties, yet remained a respected part of Hong Kong’s political elite.
2020-06-19.headline_main: The ‘Father of Democracy’ Caught Between Hong Kong’s Extremes

2020-06-19.abstract: And what else you need to know today.
2020-06-19.snippet: And what else you need to know today.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: When this country started hearing a decade ago about Dreamers — people who came to the United States as small children without legal permission — many of them were in their teens or early 20s. These Dreamers are now full adults, with careers and families, and many have spent years anxiously wondering whether they would be thrown out of the only country they’ve really known.
2020-06-19.headline_main: DACA Lives On

2020-06-19.abstract: During the pandemic, many people have been unable to make it to the bedside of their dying relatives. I was one of the lucky ones.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: With the nation gripped by protests over racial inequality, the pressure on Joseph R. Biden Jr. to pick a black woman as his running mate has been steadily growing.

2020-06-19.abstract: Nearly a century after the Tulsa Race Massacre, the search for the dead continues.
2020-06-19.snippet: Nearly a century after the Tulsa Race Massacre, the search for the dead continues.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The lynch mobs that hanged, shot or burned African-Americans alive during the early 20th century sometimes varied the means of slaughter by roping victims to cars and dragging them to death. The killers who re-enacted this barbaric ritual in Tulsa, Okla., on June 1, 1921, committed one of the defining atrocities of the Tulsa Race Massacre, the bloody conflagration during which white vigilantes murdered at will while looting and burning one of the most affluent black communities in the United States.
2020-06-19.headline_main: The Burning of Black Wall Street, Revisited

2020-06-19.abstract: How we treat animals tells us something about how we treat one another.
2020-06-19.snippet: How we treat animals tells us something about how we treat one another.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: One of the most famous men to kill a wolf was Aldo Leopold, who, as a 22-year-old forest ranger more than a century ago, slaughtered a mother and her cubs in Arizona’s Apache National Forest. Thereafter, he was forever haunted by the “fierce green fire dying” in the eyes of the elder wolf.
2020-06-19.headline_main: A Soft-Handed Predator Masquerading in Manliness

2020-06-19.snippet: The horse races took place behind closed doors this year, but thousands of people still showed up in their over-the-top finery — online.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For years, the Royal Ascot horse races have marked a high point on Maria Zherebtsova’s calendar, not just as a socialite but as a much-sought-after milliner whose creations have bedecked many a high-class cranium.
2020-06-19.headline_main: A Royal Ascot Without the Crowds, but Hats and Frocks on Full Display

2020-06-19.abstract: Maverick Carter, a high school teammate who has helped build the star’s off-court empire, says people must ask, “What do we want to change?” in the wake of nationwide protests.

2020-06-19.abstract: On her second album, “Punisher,” the singer and songwriter showcases her greatest talent: weaving tiny, specific details into big-tent tapestries of feeling.
2020-06-19.snippet: On her second album, “Punisher,” the singer and songwriter showcases her greatest talent: weaving tiny, specific details into big-tent tapestries of feeling.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The second to last song on Phoebe Bridgers’s strange and exquisitely moving new album “Punisher” is called “Graceland Too.” A restless girl who has lived through something unspeakable (“no longer a danger to herself or others,” goes the song’s ear-pricking opening line) gets in a car without a particular destination in mind, settles on Memphis and “turns up the music so thoughts don’t intrude.” Of course it doesn’t work: She “predictably winds up thinking of Elvis,” as you do.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Phoebe Bridgers Wants to Believe

2020-06-19.abstract: An investment strategy that funds lawsuits is expected to grow as more companies become involved in litigation during the economic downturn.
2020-06-19.snippet: An investment strategy that funds lawsuits is expected to grow as more companies become involved in litigation during the economic downturn.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: If there is one thing that is almost always guaranteed in an economic downturn, it’s an increase in litigation.

2020-06-19.abstract: An epic preservation battle over two tenement buildings facing York Avenue seems to have been ended by the U.S. Supreme Court. But is it really over?
2020-06-19.snippet: An epic preservation battle over two tenement buildings facing York Avenue seems to have been ended by the U.S. Supreme Court. But is it really over?
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: At 55 years old, New York City’s Landmarks Preservation Commission has reached late middle age. And for more than half the commission’s life, an epic preservation fight has been waged over two Progressive Era Upper East Side tenement buildings facing Rockefeller University.
2020-06-19.headline_main: All Quiet on the Far East Side

2020-06-19.abstract: While there are good deals to be found, particularly in the wake of Hertz’s bankruptcy filing, buyers shouldn’t count on fire-sale prices, experts say.
2020-06-19.snippet: While there are good deals to be found, particularly in the wake of Hertz’s bankruptcy filing, buyers shouldn’t count on fire-sale prices, experts say.

2020-06-19.snippet: Corporate America has pledged millions to social justice efforts since the killing of George Floyd. But some businesses have gone further, committing to concrete changes in their practices.

2020-06-19.abstract: DNA tests show an increase in the number of animals with positive tests for some coronaviruses from the time they are trapped until they arrive on someone’s dinner plate.
2020-06-19.snippet: DNA tests show an increase in the number of animals with positive tests for some coronaviruses from the time they are trapped until they arrive on someone’s dinner plate.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: A study of the wildlife trade in three provinces in southern Vietnam produced startlingly clear confirmation for one of the underlying objections to the wildlife trade in Asia — the trading offers an ideal opportunity for viruses in one animal to infect another.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Wildlife Trade Spreads Coronaviruses as Animals Get to Market

2020-06-19.abstract: Jon Stewart. Parenting black teenagers through protest and pandemic. The return of the platypuses. And more.
2020-06-19.snippet: Jon Stewart. Parenting black teenagers through protest and pandemic. The return of the platypuses. And more.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the weekend. It’s the one when we celebrate dads and father figures. It comes after a week that brought two major decisions from the Supreme Court and a drug trial that seems to help the sickest coronavirus patients. So whether you’re honoring Dad, marking Pride or just hanging out, be sure to make time for some amazing journalism.
2020-06-19.headline_main: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

2020-06-19.abstract: The actress is back in a starring role after an ordeal on the Fox drama that began with a serious illness.
2020-06-19.snippet: The actress is back in a starring role after an ordeal on the Fox drama that began with a serious illness.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: A year ago, Nicole Beharie never imagined that “Miss Juneteenth,” a small family drama celebrating African-American beauty and freedom, would be released just as another historic moment was unfolding. In fact, she hadn’t really considered Juneteenth — which honors the day the Emancipation Proclamation was read to slaves in Texas — at all before starring in the film. “I knew about the holiday, but I wasn’t celebrating it,” she admitted.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Nicole Beharie on ‘Miss Juneteenth’ and the Danger of Labels

2020-06-19.abstract: The coronavirus disproportionately affects seniors, but they may not be included in important clinical trials for vaccines and treatments.
2020-06-19.snippet: The coronavirus disproportionately affects seniors, but they may not be included in important clinical trials for vaccines and treatments.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Picture the day — in six months, a year and a half or in 2023 — when university researchers or a pharmaceutical company announces a breakthrough against the virus that causes Covid-19.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Older Adults May Be Left Out of Some Covid-19 Trials

2020-06-19.abstract: The artist Ayana Evans has been making grueling, yet nuanced performances using her own body to help audiences understand what black women often face.
2020-06-19.snippet: The artist Ayana Evans has been making grueling, yet nuanced performances using her own body to help audiences understand what black women often face.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: For her first official solo show in June 2018, the artist Ayana Evans was dressed in a skintight, neon green tiger-stripe catsuit, doing jumping jacks (in heels) or push-ups; then she challenged audience members to get down on the ground and do the push-ups with her. The audience at Medium Tings gallery in Brooklyn consisted of several artists, college friends and former students she had taught at Brown. The mood was jubilant; Ms. Evans gave everyone a hug at the end. In later performances she wore a floor-length gown, heels again and full makeup while going through the same calisthenic routines, until the makeup is washed away in a torrent of sweat and the artist almost melts into the floor. At other times she has popped up uninvited at exclusive events such as the Annual Black Ivy Alumni Gala wearing a fashionable dress and a sign pinned to her back that reads “I Just Came Here to Find a Husband.” There is no shame to her game.
2020-06-19.headline_main: What It Takes to Raise a Black Woman Up

2020-06-19.abstract: A character actor who eventually took leading roles, Mr. Holm had a range that went from the sweet-tempered to the psychotic.
2020-06-19.snippet: A character actor who eventually took leading roles, Mr. Holm had a range that went from the sweet-tempered to the psychotic.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Ian Holm, a virtuosic British actor celebrated for his performances in plays by Shakespeare and Harold Pinter and in movies from Sidney Lumet’s “Night Falls on Manhattan” to the “Lord of the Rings” and “Hobbit” trilogies, died on Friday in London. He was 88.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Ian Holm, Malleable Actor Who Played Lear and a Hobbit, Dies at 88

2020-06-19.abstract: For the first time since the 1970s, the final round of the tournament will not be played on the holiday. Our reporter reflects on what golf fans have lost — and he gained — this year.
2020-06-19.snippet: For the first time since the 1970s, the final round of the tournament will not be played on the holiday. Our reporter reflects on what golf fans have lost — and he gained — this year.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Starting in 2004, it became an annual expectation that I would not be home on Father’s Day. Don’t feel sorry for me, especially if you’re a golf fan. I was covering the final round of the United States Open, held on Father’s Day every year since 1976.
2020-06-19.headline_main: No U.S. Open on Father’s Day This Year? It’s a Gift for This Correspondent

2020-06-19.abstract: Recent protests that have stirred a reckoning on racism helped bring thousands out to celebrate a holiday commemorating the end of slavery in the United States.
2020-06-19.snippet: Recent protests that have stirred a reckoning on racism helped bring thousands out to celebrate a holiday commemorating the end of slavery in the United States.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Thousands of people flooded New York City’s streets, parks and public plazas on Friday to celebrate Juneteenth, a holiday commemorating the end of slavery in the United States that until a recent wave of protests had not been widely recognized outside black communities.
2020-06-19.headline_main: ‘Sad and Joyful’: N.Y.C. Marks Juneteenth After a Month of Protest

2020-06-19.abstract: Hear tracks by Noname, Anderson .Paak, H.E.R. and others.
2020-06-19.snippet: Hear tracks by Noname, Anderson .Paak, H.E.R. and others.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the week’s most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Aretha Franklin’s Unstoppable Faith, and 9 More New Songs

2020-06-19.abstract: Responding to Thursday’s Supreme Court decision, the president said he will follow the rules set out by the justices to challenge the Obama-era program protecting young immigrants from deportation.
2020-06-19.snippet: Responding to Thursday’s Supreme Court decision, the president said he will follow the rules set out by the justices to challenge the Obama-era program protecting young immigrants from deportation.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said Friday that he will once again attempt to end a program designed to protect young immigrants from deportation, one day after the Supreme Court said his earlier efforts to do so were arbitrary and improper.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Trump Says Administration Will Try Again to End ‘Dreamers’ Program

2020-06-19.abstract: Choose from Nicole Taylor’s curated collection of Juneteenth recipes, or spend some time with sunny summer pastas and cocktails.
2020-06-19.snippet: Choose from Nicole Taylor’s curated collection of Juneteenth recipes, or spend some time with sunny summer pastas and cocktails.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Happy Juneteenth. For The Times, Veronica Chambers put together a special package of articles about the holiday. Of course there’s food involved, as in Nicole Taylor’s curated collection of Juneteenth recipes (and in her article about how black chefs are celebrating), and in Toni Tipton-Martin’s essay about how the women she wrote about in her “The Jemima Code: Two Centuries of African American Cookbooks” transformed her, in the kitchen and on the page. Dig in.
2020-06-19.headline_main: What to Cook This Weekend

2020-06-19.abstract: The president issued a thinly veiled threat to anyone planning to demonstrate at his campaign rally on Saturday, but drew no distinction between peaceful protesters and “looters or lowlifes.”
2020-06-19.snippet: The president issued a thinly veiled threat to anyone planning to demonstrate at his campaign rally on Saturday, but drew no distinction between peaceful protesters and “looters or lowlifes.”
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump struck a combative stance on Friday for the holiday dedicated to the end of slavery, issuing a thinly veiled threat against protesters who have been marching against systemic racism and may show up at his campaign rally on Saturday in Tulsa, Okla., and warning that disruptions would not be tolerated.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Trump’s Juneteenth Tweet: A Warning to Protesters at His Tulsa Rally

2020-06-19.abstract: Born in China, he shared his intimate journey of transitioning on Instagram.
2020-06-19.snippet: Born in China, he shared his intimate journey of transitioning on Instagram.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Name: Leo Sheng
2020-06-19.headline_main: Leo Sheng, a Trans Activist Who Stars in ‘The L Word’

2020-06-19.abstract: Skill, it turns out, is what you make of luck.
2020-06-19.snippet: Skill, it turns out, is what you make of luck.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: In 2015, my life was thrown off-kilter. The year opened with my getting sick: an autoimmune condition that nobody could properly diagnose, which pushed my hormones into overdrive and rendered me unable to leave the apartment for weeklong stretches. My skin reacted to seemingly everything with a loud eruption of hives that covered my face, neck and body in a painful mosaic that made the thought of wearing clothes unbearable. As I pondered my new immobility, my husband lost his job and with it, our health insurance. And just as I thought we’d figured out a way to get it all under control, my independent, healthy grandmother slipped in the middle of the night, hit her head and never woke up.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Poker Taught Me How to Deal With the Hand of Fate

2020-06-19.abstract: Quarantine in the country means fresh air and space, but a writer’s sense of good fortune is darkened by the state of nature. “What I’m observing is unsettling,” she says.
2020-06-19.snippet: Quarantine in the country means fresh air and space, but a writer’s sense of good fortune is darkened by the state of nature. “What I’m observing is unsettling,” she says.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Farm animals know no quarantine. Horses must be fed, brought in from pasture, stalls mucked out, winter coats clipped. The farrier arrives.
2020-06-19.headline_main: On a Pennsylvania Farm, ‘Nature Is Not Just Carrying On’

2020-06-19.abstract: A week of decisions contained hidden and not-so-hidden messages from the court.
2020-06-19.snippet: A week of decisions contained hidden and not-so-hidden messages from the court.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Suppose there had been a leak from the Supreme Court early Thursday morning: The court was about to issue its long-awaited decision in the DACA case on the fate of nearly 700,000 young immigrants known as Dreamers; the vote was 5 to 4; and the majority opinion was by Chief Justice John Roberts. But the leaker didn’t know, or wouldn’t say, which way the case came out.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Roberts to Trump: Don’t Take the Supreme Court for Granted

2020-06-19.abstract: How Abraham Foxman, former head of the Anti-Defamation League, became the redemption broker.
2020-06-19.snippet: How Abraham Foxman, former head of the Anti-Defamation League, became the redemption broker.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: It would not be an exaggeration to say that among the managerial class in New York, an anxiety around cancellation has now surpassed any fear of Covid-19. People are at home, restless — scrolling through the past for the potentially offensive gaffe, the expression of an outdated view, the eruption that should have been a gentle reprimand (are reprimands still OK?), the office-party re-enactment of favorite scenes from “Annie Hall.” The revolution — which now extends beyond race to encompass all the ways we communicate across difference — is not interested in your excuses.
2020-06-19.headline_main: They Were Canceled. Should He Have Helped Them Come Back?

2020-06-19.abstract: “Sitting in Limbo,” a BBC drama, is inspired by one story from the “Windrush generation,” the British residents of Caribbean heritage who were mistakenly identified as illegal immigrants.
2020-06-19.snippet: “Sitting in Limbo,” a BBC drama, is inspired by one story from the “Windrush generation,” the British residents of Caribbean heritage who were mistakenly identified as illegal immigrants.

2020-06-19.headline_main: Dramatizing the Human Toll of a U.K. Political Scandal

2020-06-19.abstract: Pandemic fears have created interest in metallic products touting antimicrobial properties. But experts have doubts about the copper craze.
2020-06-19.snippet: Pandemic fears have created interest in metallic products touting antimicrobial properties. But experts have doubts about the copper craze.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: It began in mid-March. Every time Michael D. L. Johnson checked his email, the University of Arizona microbiologist would find a new batch of messages, all asking the same question: Will products made with copper keep the coronavirus at bay?
2020-06-19.headline_main: Copper Won’t Save You From Coronavirus

2020-06-19.abstract: Even without peak produce, these recipes evoke the season.
2020-06-19.snippet: Even without peak produce, these recipes evoke the season.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Hello, it’s Emily, and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. As of Saturday, summer is here. The local gems of the season aren’t, though, at least not where I am in the Northeast — no corn, no tomatoes, no blueberries, not yet. But aren’t you ready to eat them anyway? I am ready to eat them anyway, along with breezy pastas and dishes that evoke a backyard barbecue on a Saturday even if they were made in the oven on a Wednesday.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Summer Preview

2020-06-19.abstract: The Holy Face of Lucca, an 8-foot-tall crucifix with a central role in Christian iconography, has survived more than 1,000 years.
2020-06-19.snippet: The Holy Face of Lucca, an 8-foot-tall crucifix with a central role in Christian iconography, has survived more than 1,000 years.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: ROME — For centuries, in a picturesque Tuscan town near the Mediterranean coast, legions of pilgrims came to venerate one of Christendom’s most treasured relics — an eight-foot-tall wooden crucifix known as the “Volto Santo de Lucca.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: A Long Revered Relic Is Found to Be Europe’s Oldest Surviving Wooden Statue

2020-06-19.abstract: Shows of support from Facebook, Twitter and YouTube don’t address the way those platforms have been weaponized by racists and partisan provocateurs.
2020-06-19.snippet: Shows of support from Facebook, Twitter and YouTube don’t address the way those platforms have been weaponized by racists and partisan provocateurs.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Several weeks ago, as protests erupted across the nation in response to the police killing of George Floyd, Mark Zuckerberg wrote a long and heartfelt post on his Facebook page, denouncing racial bias and proclaiming that “black lives matter.” Mr. Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, also announced that the company would donate $10 million to racial justice organizations.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Social Media Giants Support Racial Justice. Their Products Undermine It.

2020-06-19.abstract: Apple could announce plans as soon as Monday to replace Intel processors in Macs with chips that it designed itself.
2020-06-19.snippet: Apple could announce plans as soon as Monday to replace Intel processors in Macs with chips that it designed itself.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Silicon Valley is bracing for a long-expected breakup of Apple and Intel, signaling both the end of one of the tech industry’s most influential partnerships and Apple’s determination to take more control of how its products are built.
2020-06-19.headline_main: After 15 Years, Apple Prepares to Break Up With Intel

2020-06-19.abstract: Without an opportunity for debate and changes, the effort is likely to collapse as so many others have in the risk-averse chamber.

2020-06-19.headline_main: Policing Bill Will Test Whether a Rusty Senate Can Still Legislate

2020-06-19.abstract: Moni Yakim has taught movement at Juilliard since 1968. A new film captures his impact on scores of actors. “He’s not a coddler,” says Jessica Chastain.

2020-06-19.abstract: “Currently unemployed,” said the youngest Nobel Peace Prize laureate. But for now, it’s time for some rest and Netflix.

2020-06-19.abstract: Brett Hankison blindly fired 10 rounds into a covered door and window, according to a termination letter.
2020-06-19.snippet: Brett Hankison blindly fired 10 rounds into a covered door and window, according to a termination letter.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The police in Louisville, Ky., are moving to terminate one of the officers involved in the death of Breonna Taylor, Mayor Greg Fischer announced on Friday, the first significant action taken against an officer in a case that has drawn widespread criticism and national protests.

2020-06-19.abstract: When two men were found hanging from trees in Southern California, the authorities quickly ruled them suicides. After an outcry from activists, investigations were opened.
2020-06-19.snippet: When two men were found hanging from trees in Southern California, the authorities quickly ruled them suicides. After an outcry from activists, investigations were opened.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: PALMDALE, Calif. — Poncitlan Square in the center of this high desert city is a tidy expanse of green lawn with a gazebo and a fountain. On one side is City Hall, on the other, a fire station. There is a cafe and the Whispering Palms Apartments. This time last year, for the first time, it was filled with revelers celebrating Juneteenth, the annual holiday to mark the end of slavery.
2020-06-19.headline_main: In California, Hanging Deaths of Two Black Men Summon a Dark History and F.B.I. Scrutiny

2020-06-19.abstract: The company’s orchestra offered prestige and job security. But the pandemic has upended hundreds of lives.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Hugo Valverde didn’t think he’d make it when he auditioned for the orchestra of the Metropolitan Opera, the nation’s largest performing arts organization and its most prestigious opera company.

2020-06-19.abstract: Few politicians delight in seizing on the news of the day, or even the hour, to ridicule their rivals as President Trump, but Joseph Biden has been mostly off camera and avoiding gaffes.

2020-06-19.abstract: Kevin Bacon and Amanda Seyfried play parents taking a much-needed break in Wales, only to find their vacation home isn’t what it seems.
2020-06-19.snippet: Kevin Bacon and Amanda Seyfried play parents taking a much-needed break in Wales, only to find their vacation home isn’t what it seems.

The film, which was adapted by the director David Koepp  from Daniel Kehlmann’s novel of the same name, aims for depth but only wades through shallow waters.

2020-06-19.abstract: Jill Snyder says she is stepping down “to advance the movement for change that is now sweeping through our culture.”
2020-06-19.snippet: Jill Snyder says she is stepping down “to advance the movement for change that is now sweeping through our culture.”
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Jill Snyder, who has served as director of the Museum of Contemporary Art Cleveland for 23 years, resigned on Friday, the museum said in a statement, “to begin a transition to new leadership” for the contemporary art institution. Her departure comes nearly two weeks after Ms. Snyder publicly apologized to an artist for canceling his exhibition dealing with police killings of black and Latino boys and men.
2020-06-19.headline_main: MoCA Cleveland Director Resigns After Canceling Show on Police Brutality

2020-06-19.abstract: John Bolton, the former national security adviser, alleged that President Trump had pressed China to buy farm goods for political reasons. Those purchases have not made up for the trade-war damage.
2020-06-19.snippet: John Bolton, the former national security adviser, alleged that President Trump had pressed China to buy farm goods for political reasons. Those purchases have not made up for the trade-war damage.

2020-06-19.abstract: The theater’s dependence on a troupe of volunteer actors has drawn criticism for years. An angry public letter prompted a promise of change.
2020-06-19.snippet: The theater’s dependence on a troupe of volunteer actors has drawn criticism for years. An angry public letter prompted a promise of change.

2020-06-19.abstract: He united people in shelters with those living on the streets, and he negotiated with city officials for greater support.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Nikita Price’s father named him after Nikita Khrushchev, the Soviet premier, during the height of the Cold War, and it was just the sort of gesture Nikita would appreciate, his friends said: defiant, outraged, but with a sly wink at the absurdity of it.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Nikita Price, Homeless Father Turned Advocate for Homeless, Dies at 63

2020-06-19.abstract: A review shows that the number of people killed by police activity in New York is more than twice what has been reported.
2020-06-19.snippet: A review shows that the number of people killed by police activity in New York is more than twice what has been reported.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: On the morning of May 30, as protests over the killing of George Floyd were sweeping the country, Mary Bassett, a prominent expert at Harvard University’s public health school and New York City’s former health commissioner, sent an email to Mayor Bill de Blasio.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Why Was a Grim Report on Police-Involved Deaths Never Released?

2020-06-19.abstract: New research shows that the nectar-drinking birds use their enhanced color vision to distinguish sources of food.
2020-06-19.snippet: New research shows that the nectar-drinking birds use their enhanced color vision to distinguish sources of food.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Hummingbirds were already impressive. They move like hurried insects, turn on aerial dimes and extract nectar from flowers with almost surgical precision. But they conceal another talent, too: seeing colors that human eyes can’t perceive.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Hummingbirds Navigate an Ultraviolet World We Never See

2020-06-19.abstract: Elizabeth Alexander reflects on her seminal Rodney King essay, the George Floyd killing and how the videos of police brutality exacerbate black grief.
2020-06-19.snippet: Elizabeth Alexander reflects on her seminal Rodney King essay, the George Floyd killing and how the videos of police brutality exacerbate black grief.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: In 1994, Elizabeth Alexander, poet, scholar, and president of the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation published “‘Can you be Black and Look at This?’: Reading the Rodney King Video(s).” The essay grieved the beating of Rodney King by four white Los Angeles police officers in 1991. It also grappled with the trauma that African-American viewers, in particular, experienced after repeatedly watching George Holliday’s 81-second videotape of the assault on television before the trial and during the riots that occurred after the mostly-white jury acquitted the officers.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Endless Grief: The Spectacle of ‘Black Bodies in Pain’

2020-06-19.abstract: Portraits and statues venerating Confederate leaders are an insult to freedom and democracy.
2020-06-19.snippet: Portraits and statues venerating Confederate leaders are an insult to freedom and democracy.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Confederate statues are being pulled down across the South — from Birmingham, Ala., to Decatur, Ga., to Richmond, Va., the Confederacy’s former capital. The U.S. Navy and the Marines have banned public displays of the Confederate battle flag — as has NASCAR.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Why Is the G.O.P. Fighting to Preserve Monuments to Traitors in the Capitol?

2020-06-19.abstract: Portraits of a family adapting to their new reality.
2020-06-19.snippet: Portraits of a family adapting to their new reality.

2020-06-19.headline_main: When Day Care Closed, a Father Rediscovered His Daughter

2020-06-19.headline_main: A Sign, Rising 45 Feet, Heralds the Juneteenth Holiday in New York

2020-06-19.abstract: Mr. Floyd was arrested in Houston over a $10 drug transaction. Now thousands of cases involving the officer who arrested him and his squad are under review.
2020-06-19.snippet: Mr. Floyd was arrested in Houston over a $10 drug transaction. Now thousands of cases involving the officer who arrested him and his squad are under review.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — In many of Houston’s struggling neighborhoods, a black undercover narcotics officer worked for decades, making bust after bust.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Probe of Old Drug Cases Raises Questions About 2004 George Floyd Arrest

2020-06-19.headline_main: Lynika Strozier, Who Researched Early Plant DNA, Dies at 35

2020-06-19.abstract: The German company’s share price has plunged 80 percent, and its longtime chief executive has resigned.
2020-06-19.snippet: The German company’s share price has plunged 80 percent, and its longtime chief executive has resigned.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Wirecard, a Germany company that soared in value in recent years as it provided a widening array of payment services around the world, was suddenly collapsing on Friday amid questions surrounding missing cash balances amounting to 1.9 billion euros, about $2.1 billion.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Wirecard, a Payments Firm, Is Rocked by a Report of a Missing $2 Billion

2020-06-19.abstract: In his relatively short career, Rajput rose to leading man. Here are some of his best performances.
2020-06-19.snippet: In his relatively short career, Rajput rose to leading man. Here are some of his best performances.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The death of the Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput, who came to prominence in romantic hero roles in film and television, has resulted in an outpouring of remembrances in India from leaders and actors alike. On Twitter, Prime Minister Narendra Modi called Rajput “a bright young actor gone too soon.” Ekta Kapoor, a television producer who was credited with launching Rajput’s television career, posted an emotional video tribute. And Rajput’s idol, the actor Shah Rukh Khan, wrote, “I will miss him so much.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: 4 Great Sushant Singh Rajput Roles to Stream

2020-06-19.abstract: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada said he was disappointed with China’s move to indict two Canadians on charges of espionage.
2020-06-19.snippet: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada said he was disappointed with China’s move to indict two Canadians on charges of espionage.

2020-06-19.headline_main: Trudeau Reacts to China’s Decision on Detained Canadians

2020-06-19.abstract: The Neutrogena and Clean & Clear products, which were advertised as dark-spot reducers and were sold in Asia and the Middle East, will soon come off the shelves, the manufacturer said.
2020-06-19.snippet: The Neutrogena and Clean & Clear products, which were advertised as dark-spot reducers and were sold in Asia and the Middle East, will soon come off the shelves, the manufacturer said.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: The consumer-products giant Johnson & Johnson said on Friday that it would no longer sell certain products that are advertised as dark-spot reducers but have been used by some purchasers to lighten skin tone.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Johnson & Johnson Will Stop Selling Skin-Whitening Lotions

2020-06-19.abstract: From Minneapolis to Buffalo, Homeland Security officials dispatched drones, helicopters and airplanes to monitor Black Lives Matter protests.
2020-06-19.snippet: From Minneapolis to Buffalo, Homeland Security officials dispatched drones, helicopters and airplanes to monitor Black Lives Matter protests.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: GRAND FORKS, N.D. — The Department of Homeland Security deployed helicopters, airplanes and drones over 15 cities where demonstrators gathered to protest the death of George Floyd, logging at least 270 hours of surveillance, far more than previously revealed, according to Customs and Border Protection data.
2020-06-19.headline_main: U.S. Watched George Floyd Protests in 15 Cities Using Aerial Surveillance

2020-06-19.abstract: Spurs bet the club’s financial future on a spaceship of a stadium. But without fans to pay the mortgage and strengthen the team, can it build the future it envisioned?
2020-06-19.snippet: Spurs bet the club’s financial future on a spaceship of a stadium. But without fans to pay the mortgage and strengthen the team, can it build the future it envisioned?
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It was for nights like this that Tottenham Hotspur Stadium was built. It was on nights like this — hosting a clash between Spurs and Manchester United, global soccer royalty, under the lights — that the arena would have been expected to be at its captivating best.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Tottenham Returns With a Tie, but Its Losses Are Mounting

2020-06-19.abstract: The city received 1,737 fireworks complaints in the first half of June, 80 times as many as it got in the same period last year.
2020-06-19.snippet: The city received 1,737 fireworks complaints in the first half of June, 80 times as many as it got in the same period last year.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: New York, an already-jittery city transformed by the coronavirus pandemic and protests against police brutality and systemic racism, now has its own cacophonous soundtrack: illegal fireworks being set off in soaring numbers from late afternoon until the wee hours of the morning.
2020-06-19.headline_main: New Woe for a Jittery N.Y.C.: Illegal Fireworks Going Off All Night

2020-06-19.abstract: How we found the voice to tell a 155-year-old story of celebration and setbacks, historically and personally.
2020-06-19.snippet: How we found the voice to tell a 155-year-old story of celebration and setbacks, historically and personally.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: On today’s show, we told the history of Juneteenth, a 155-year-old story of joy and pain, celebration and setbacks, that have lived side by side for black Americans since the day that a Union soldier walked into Galveston, Texas, and declared that the enslaved people there were emancipated. It’s a rich and complicated history that the producers and editors on the team felt was not well enough understood.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Joy, Pain and Juneteenth

2020-06-19.abstract: The order to inform Texans that “all slaves are free” was found in a Union Army records book in the National Archives in Washington on Thursday.
2020-06-19.snippet: The order to inform Texans that “all slaves are free” was found in a Union Army records book in the National Archives in Washington on Thursday.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Archivists in Washington, D.C., made a timely discovery this week: the original handwritten Union Army record of an order that brought emancipation to enslaved people in Texas at the end of the Civil War.
2020-06-19.headline_main: The 1865 Handwritten Order Marking Juneteenth Has Been Found

2020-06-19.abstract: His best-selling “Bible Code” books claimed that historical and future events were encoded in the Old Testament, although he couldn’t explain how or why.
2020-06-19.snippet: His best-selling “Bible Code” books claimed that historical and future events were encoded in the Old Testament, although he couldn’t explain how or why.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: As a Hebrew school student, Michael Drosnin was asked to write down what he had learned. He responded, “That I don’t have to believe in God or anything in the Bible.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: Michael Drosnin, Who Found Clues in the Bible, Is Dead at 74

2020-06-19.abstract: “If I was living in America,” one England-based player said, “I’d be playing right now.”
2020-06-19.snippet: “If I was living in America,” one England-based player said, “I’d be playing right now.”
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: England’s top player, Tommy Fleetwood, was the world No. 10, one spot ahead of Tiger Woods, when the PGA Tour suspended its schedule in March. With four top-3 finishes in his seven worldwide starts before the coronavirus halted the season, Fleetwood had momentum on his side. But when tour play resumed last week, he was on the wrong side of the Atlantic.
2020-06-19.headline_main: In PGA Tour’s Rush to Move Forward, Foreign Pros Were Left Behind

2020-06-19.abstract: He was an All-Star fastball pitcher with the Giants until he developed a sore arm. He salvaged his career by learning to throw a screwball.
2020-06-19.snippet: He was an All-Star fastball pitcher with the Giants until he developed a sore arm. He salvaged his career by learning to throw a screwball.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Mike McCormick, who threw his first major league pitch at age 17 with the 1956 New York Giants, was a two-time All-Star with the Giants in San Francisco, and later overcame a sore arm to win the 1967 Cy Young Award as the National League’s leading pitcher, died on June 13 at his home in Cornelius, N.C. He was 81.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Mike McCormick, Comeback Cy Young Award Winner, Dies at 81

2020-06-19.abstract: A letter signed by hundreds of artists, writers, film producers and directors, actors and singers demanded that institutions be “active agents” in fighting racism.
2020-06-19.snippet: A letter signed by hundreds of artists, writers, film producers and directors, actors and singers demanded that institutions be “active agents” in fighting racism.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: A letter released on Friday that carried the names of some of the most influential black figures in film, television, visual art, music, theater, literature and other cultural disciplines called on the institutions they work with to actively fight racism by cutting ties with the police, as well as financially supporting and advocating for black artists and their work.
2020-06-19.headline_main: Black Cultural Leaders Make a Unified Call: ‘Value Our Work’

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — New details from the Justice Department’s inquiry into Russian influence over the 2016 election released on Friday underscored President Trump’s keen interest in weaponizing information stolen by the Russians and funneled to WikiLeaks for use against his 2016 opponent, Hillary Clinton.

2020-06-19.abstract: Reading is contagious, especially in a pandemic.
2020-06-19.snippet: Reading is contagious, especially in a pandemic.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: During the coronavirus lockdown, a fifth-grade teacher, Linda, contacted me asking for help. She teaches in a school district in Southern California where over 80 percent of the students qualify for free lunches. Linda was struggling with students’ not showing up for online class. “Before the lockdown, I had started reading ‘It Ain’t So Awful, Falafel,’ so I thought of asking if you have any ideas,” she said. “The kids all related to your story about being an immigrant and having to translate for your mom.”
2020-06-19.headline_main: How a Coronavirus Story Hour Became the Highlight of My Week

2020-06-19.abstract: Before you ask to speak to your own manager, relax. This isn’t really “work,” and you’re not alone.
2020-06-19.snippet: Before you ask to speak to your own manager, relax. This isn’t really “work,” and you’re not alone.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: There are a lot of reading lists being passed around among us whites. Besides books on racism and antiracism, there are documentaries to watch, conversations to unpack, privilege to be examined and a foreboding sense of work to be done.
2020-06-19.headline_main: To White People Who Want to Be ‘One of the Good Ones’

2020-06-19.abstract: Beijing saw a threat in New Delhi’s steady improvement of borderland infrastructure and renewed Indian claims on disputed territory.
2020-06-19.snippet: Beijing saw a threat in New Delhi’s steady improvement of borderland infrastructure and renewed Indian claims on disputed territory.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Tensions between Indian and Chinese troops have simmered since early May in the remote, high Karakoram mountains that separate India’s northern Ladakh region from the alkaline desert of Aksai Chin, which is claimed by India but controlled by China and abuts its Xinjiang province.
2020-06-19.headline_main: How China and India Came to Lethal Blows

But on Friday, the ominous backdrop of those talks — the coronavirus pandemic — showed just how little the two sides really control.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — The world has entered a “new and dangerous phase” of the coronavirus pandemic, a top official from the World Health Organization said on Friday, a stark warning that came as the United States struggled to control spiraling outbreaks and as business leaders signaled growing unease with the country’s ability to effectively contend with the virus.

2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: McRAE, Ga. — It’s appalling to see the seal of the U.S. State Department desecrated. Mike Pompeo, the secretary of state, has no conscience, so I assume it did not occur to him that settling scores with John Bolton, the former national security adviser, beneath that seal was wrong, an affront to the honor of every Foreign Service officer.

2020-06-19.abstract: Was John Bolton gullible or cynical? Yes.
2020-06-19.snippet: Was John Bolton gullible or cynical? Yes.
2020-06-19.lead_paragraph: Karl Popper once said, “A theory that explains everything, explains nothing.” John Bolton’s forthcoming memoir of his 17-month stint as Donald Trump’s national security adviser, “The Room Where It Happened,” offers a corollary: A book that tells all, yet somehow manages to tell nothing.
2020-06-19.headline_main: The Doom Where It Happened

2020-06-20.abstract: The Alaska Army National Guard transported the bus to a “secure site” after two hikers have died and at least 15 have had to be rescued while trying to reach the bus in the remote Alaskan wilderness.
2020-06-20.snippet: The Alaska Army National Guard transported the bus to a “secure site” after two hikers have died and at least 15 have had to be rescued while trying to reach the bus in the remote Alaskan wilderness.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: It was known as “Bus 142” and the “Magic Bus,” and the rusty green-and-white vehicle had exerted a dangerous and almost talismanic power over hikers for nearly a quarter century — ever since the book “Into the Wild” immortalized Christopher McCandless’s solitary odyssey and lonely death in the Alaskan outback.
2020-06-20.headline_main: ‘Into the Wild’ Bus, Seen as a Danger, Is Airlifted From the Alaskan Wild

2020-06-20.abstract: Stella Zawistowski drops into her Saturday groove.
2020-06-20.snippet: Stella Zawistowski drops into her Saturday groove.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — I listened to this album (spoiler at that link!) in the background while I worked on this post. It’s the seed entry to Stella Zawistowski’s second Saturday puzzle for The Times, and it’s wonderfully lush and romantic. There’s a lot of rhythm and action in this grid. I made a couple of missteps, but it wasn’t too difficult to get swept up in the music and float over and through.
2020-06-20.headline_main: Performing Well

2020-06-20.abstract: Attorney General William Barr tried to fire the U.S. attorney in Manhattan, Geoffrey Berman, but he is refusing to leave.
2020-06-20.snippet: Attorney General William Barr tried to fire the U.S. attorney in Manhattan, Geoffrey Berman, but he is refusing to leave.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: The top federal prosecutor in Manhattan, who has investigated President Trump’s closest associates, was refusing to leave his position on Saturday after Attorney General William P. Barr tried to fire him, setting up an extraordinary standoff over the independence of law enforcement and the president’s purge of officials he views as disloyal.
2020-06-20.headline_main: Clash Over U.S. Attorney Who Investigated Trump Associates Sets Off Crisis

2020-06-20.abstract: Corrections that appeared in print on Saturday, June 20, 2020.
2020-06-20.snippet: Corrections that appeared in print on Saturday, June 20, 2020.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: An article on Thursday about the Chinese government’s effort to collect DNA samples from males across China misstated comments from Dr. Zhong Chang, a researcher at the U.S. firm Thermo Fisher. When speaking about genetic testing kits the company was marketing to Chinese law enforcement, Dr. Zhong said the kits are calibrated so that they can effectively gather DNA information from China’s ethnic minorities like Uighurs and Tibetans, not that they could distinguish ethnic minorities from other groups. (A spokesman for Thermo Fisher said the kits lack that capability.)
2020-06-20.headline_main: Corrections: June 20, 2020

2020-06-20.abstract: Will the thousands of Trump supporters wear masks? What time is the rally? How will President Trump talk about race? What protests will he face? Here’s what you need to know.

2020-06-20.abstract: As you mark the longest day of the year, consider the debate among astronomers over whether Earth’s tilt toward the sun helps make life on our world and others possible.
2020-06-20.snippet: As you mark the longest day of the year, consider the debate among astronomers over whether Earth’s tilt toward the sun helps make life on our world and others possible.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: On the summer solstice this Saturday, the Northern Hemisphere will dip toward the sun and bathe in direct sunlight for longer than any other day of the year. That will cause the sun to rise early, climb high into the sky — sweeping far above city skylines or mountain peaks — and set late into the evening.
2020-06-20.headline_main: Summer Solstice 2020 and the Search for Life in the Galaxy

2020-06-20.abstract: Eliza Scanlen stars in a new coming-of-age drama, and Carson Kressley hosts a special aimed at helping pet owners groom from home.
2020-06-20.snippet: Eliza Scanlen stars in a new coming-of-age drama, and Carson Kressley hosts a special aimed at helping pet owners groom from home.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: BABYTEETH (2019) Rent or buy on Amazon, Google Play, iTunes, Vudu, YouTube and pay TV operators. What if, at 16, you knew your first love could also possibly be your last? That’s the question at the heart of this family drama, which stars Eliza Scanlen as Milla, a teenager grappling with the onset of a serious, and possibly terminal, illness. As Milla’s parents (played by Ben Mendelsohn and Essie Davis) struggle to deal with their daughter’s diagnosis, they become even more alarmed when Milla brings home Moses (Toby Wallace), a homeless and drug addled 23-year-old. “He proves to be a prince in greasy threads,” Manohla Dargis writes in her review for The New York Times. “A sad-boy fantasy who proves as pure-hearted as Milla, or rather as the story needs him to be.”
2020-06-20.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘Babyteeth’ and ‘The Great American Groom-A-Long’

But she does have an innovative way to repurpose your empty cans, toilet paper rolls and old newspapers: by making a “junk vessel.”

2020-06-20.abstract: The coronavirus has devastated Latin America. And it has only been worsened by a wave of graft and profiteering, prosecutors say.
2020-06-20.snippet: The coronavirus has devastated Latin America. And it has only been worsened by a wave of graft and profiteering, prosecutors say.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: Of all the schemes that have siphoned resources from Latin American countries fighting the coronavirus, the body bag conspiracy might be the most brazen.
2020-06-20.headline_main: Latin America’s Virus Villains: Corrupt Officials Collude With Price Gougers for Body Bags and Flimsy Masks

2020-06-20.abstract: Amy McGrath was considered a safe bet in the Democratic primary. But the recent movement for racial justice has elevated the candidacy of her African-American rival, Charles Booker, in the race to defeat Mitch McConnell.
2020-06-20.snippet: Amy McGrath was considered a safe bet in the Democratic primary. But the recent movement for racial justice has elevated the candidacy of her African-American rival, Charles Booker, in the race to defeat Mitch McConnell.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: LEXINGTON, Ky. — Senate Democrats thought they had it all planned out.
2020-06-20.headline_main: In Kentucky, Racial Justice Movement Transforms Quest to Oust McConnell

2020-06-20.abstract: The current protests are unprecedented in their number, scope and impact, but their newness is built on a long past, one that scholars have grappled with for decades.
2020-06-20.snippet: The current protests are unprecedented in their number, scope and impact, but their newness is built on a long past, one that scholars have grappled with for decades.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: No book can provide a full understanding of the complex pain and enduring injustice that is the recent wave of countrywide protests. But books can provide context and texture, and memoirs and sociology texts by black writers have been flying off the shelves. So have history books.
2020-06-20.headline_main: 6 Books to Help You Grasp How We Got to This Moment

2020-06-20.abstract: June is Pride Month, but high rents and little-to-no income mean establishments including the Stonewall Inn are “facing an uncertain future.”
2020-06-20.snippet: June is Pride Month, but high rents and little-to-no income mean establishments including the Stonewall Inn are “facing an uncertain future.”
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: Protesters have returned to the Stonewall Inn again and again in recent weeks to demand an end to police brutality, raising their fists, taking a knee and holding moments of silence on the same ground where a riot in 1969 helped spark the modern gay rights movement.
2020-06-20.headline_main: Can Gay Bars, an Anchor of N.Y.C. Nightlife, Survive the Pandemic?

2020-06-20.abstract: “We shouldn’t be screaming, ‘Trans Lives Matter,’ but we have to,” said Leiomy Maldonado, a ballroom icon. “We’re strong and we’re here to fight.”
2020-06-20.snippet: “We shouldn’t be screaming, ‘Trans Lives Matter,’ but we have to,” said Leiomy Maldonado, a ballroom icon. “We’re strong and we’re here to fight.”
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, videos emerged of members of the ballroom community voguing in hazmat suits, holding “kiki” battles via TikTok and creating hand washing tutorials with new coronavirus-inspired beats and chants. Then came the videos of members cat walking with protesters, dropping into “dips” in front of police cars, voguing at impromptu protest balls and marching the asphalt runway while holding Black Lives Matter signs.
2020-06-20.headline_main: Voguing for Our Lives. Again.

2020-06-20.abstract: Southern officials warn of new clusters linked to bars and frat parties. Health officials feared the Trump campaign rally in Tulsa, Okla., could be a “superspreader” event. Workers in Japan have avoided the mass layoffs seen in other countries.
2020-06-20.snippet: Southern officials warn of new clusters linked to bars and frat parties. Health officials feared the Trump campaign rally in Tulsa, Okla., could be a “superspreader” event. Workers in Japan have avoided the mass layoffs seen in other countries.

2020-06-20.abstract: A mix of social, demographic and epidemiological factors has kept unemployment down even as the coronavirus has damaged the country’s already weakened economy.

2020-06-20.headline_main: Why Japan’s Jobless Rate Is Just 2.6% While the U.S.’s Has Soared

2020-06-20.abstract: The Democratic-led House and Republican-led Senate, which had approved competing plans, failed to compromise before a weeklong special session ended.
2020-06-20.snippet: The Democratic-led House and Republican-led Senate, which had approved competing plans, failed to compromise before a weeklong special session ended.

2020-06-20.abstract: Even in a pandemic you can still invite friends over for a safe swim. And go ahead, hog the pool float.
2020-06-20.snippet: Even in a pandemic you can still invite friends over for a safe swim. And go ahead, hog the pool float.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: In a normal summer, having friends over for a swim is one of the easy joys for people fortunate enough to have a backyard pool. Now, it can feel fraught, even as water-lovers everywhere are desperate for aquatic relief with the closure of many public pools. But experts say it is possible to share your oasis safely.
2020-06-20.headline_main: How to Share Your Backyard Pool

2020-06-20.abstract: Your apartment hasn’t gotten any bigger, and you need to store your bike without making the place unlivable. Here are some options.
2020-06-20.snippet: Your apartment hasn’t gotten any bigger, and you need to store your bike without making the place unlivable. Here are some options.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: Q: My boyfriend wants to get a bike because he’s worried about riding the subway during the pandemic. But we rent an alcove studio in Brooklyn and we have so little space. I cannot imagine how we’d store a bike. Can we store it in the hallway?

2020-06-20.snippet: PVC pipe, cardboard boxes, even bobblehead dolls can all be part of a backyard nine.
2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: On an unseasonably warm day about a week into the coronavirus shutdown, Elena Delle Donne — a star player for the Washington Mystics of the W.N.B.A., Olympic gold medalist in basketball and avid golfer — and her wife, Amanda, were musing about how nice it would be if golf courses were open. A short time later, Ms. Delle Donne emerged from a basement workout to find that Amanda had built an intricate mini-golf course in their Alexandria, Va., front yard.
2020-06-20.headline_main: How to Make a Mini-Golf Course

2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: Every black southern family that I’m aware of has a cold case. The murder of a family member by a white man about which records might have disappeared or been deleted. It’s family oral tradition that keeps the story alive.

2020-06-20.abstract: I knew I had to be honest.

2020-06-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s former national security adviser John R. Bolton can go forward with the publication of his memoir, a federal judge ruled on Saturday, rejecting the administration’s request for an order that he try to pull the book back and saying it was too late for such an order to succeed.
