2020-06-25.abstract: She’s not happy, and her student isn’t laughing, either. Nina Hoss is impeccable in this film by Ina Weisse.
2020-06-25.snippet: She’s not happy, and her student isn’t laughing, either. Nina Hoss is impeccable in this film by Ina Weisse.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: This picture kicks off with a scene we may think we’ve seen many times: a tryout at a prestigious music school. A group of exacting adults assesses a series of young classical players; we may think the aspiring ones sound OK or better, but the grown-ups are brutal. It’s their job to be, and their ears are trained to be.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘The Audition’ Review: A Violin Teacher on the Verge

2020-06-25.abstract: This documentary from Leslie Woodhead gives the first lady of song a dry, PBS-ready treatment.
2020-06-25.snippet: This documentary from Leslie Woodhead gives the first lady of song a dry, PBS-ready treatment.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: “Ella Fitzgerald: Just One of Those Things” salutes the singer who became known as the first lady of song — whose six-decade career stretched from the comforts of novelty tunes to the cutting edge of jazz — with a PBS-ready treatment. It proceeds dryly and largely chronologically through her life, sometimes with an awkward sense of proportion. (Is it necessary for a full closing title card to note that Fitzgerald, who died in 1996, had both legs amputated toward the end of her life?)
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘Ella Fitzgerald: Just One of Those Things’ Review: Words Without Much Music

2020-06-25.abstract: This new documentary is assembled from voluminous footage shot by Shannon Hoon, the lead singer of Blind Melon, until the day he died.
2020-06-25.snippet: This new documentary is assembled from voluminous footage shot by Shannon Hoon, the lead singer of Blind Melon, until the day he died.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: The musician Shannon Hoon, who died in 1995 of complications from a drug overdose at the age of 28, was an inveterate self-chronicler. The documentary “All I Can Say” credits Hoon as one of four directors and was assembled from video footage he recorded from 1990 until mere hours before his death. It chronicles, among other things, the rise and decline of his band Blind Melon.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘All I Can Say’ Review: A Rock Star Captures His Own Rise and Fall

2020-06-25.abstract: The director Christopher Munch’s first feature since 2011 is both whimsical and dark.
2020-06-25.snippet: The director Christopher Munch’s first feature since 2011 is both whimsical and dark.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Christopher Munch has a near-unique filmmaking voice, possessed of an understatement that can register either as droll or profound, and sometimes as both. He doesn’t get to exercise that voice too frequently, alas.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘The 11th Green’ Review: Investigating Aliens, Eisenhower and Golf

2020-06-25.abstract: The tournament’s original framework released last week eliminated the competition, a decision many wheelchair players said had been made without consulting them.
2020-06-25.snippet: The tournament’s original framework released last week eliminated the competition, a decision many wheelchair players said had been made without consulting them.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: After an outcry from players, the United States Tennis Association has restored the wheelchair tennis competition to the 2020 United States Open.
2020-06-25.headline_main: U.S.T.A. Reinstates U.S. Open Wheelchair Tournament

2020-06-25.abstract: “Korean Art From 1953,” a lavish new book, is the most significant English-language overview yet of modern and contemporary art on the peninsula.
2020-06-25.snippet: “Korean Art From 1953,” a lavish new book, is the most significant English-language overview yet of modern and contemporary art on the peninsula.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Many rich nations use art, music and movies to project an image to the world, but few take it as seriously as South Korea — today’s uncontested champion of cultural soft power. In the last 20 years, the nation’s singers and actors have thumped to Asian and then worldwide superstardom — signaled in 2012 by the viral amusement “Gangnam Style” (the first song to hit a billion views on YouTube); strengthened by the stadium-filling concerts of BTS, Loona and other K-pop bands; and capped recently by the unprecedented best picture Oscar for Bong Joon Ho’s “Parasite.”
2020-06-25.headline_main: A Full View, at Last, of Modern Art in South Korea

2020-06-25.abstract: “I was actually quite pleased.”
2020-06-25.snippet: “I was actually quite pleased.”
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: What books are on your nightstand?
2020-06-25.headline_main: Roddy Doyle Scored 8 Out of 10 on a Quiz About Roddy Doyle

2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Damning testimony and election warnings. It’s Thursday, and this is your tip sheet.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Bombshell Testimony Against Trump and Barr

2020-06-25.abstract: An unlikely source of comfort viewing, YouTube compilations of old commercials have provided the writer a strange kind of optimism when so much else seems broken.
2020-06-25.snippet: An unlikely source of comfort viewing, YouTube compilations of old commercials have provided the writer a strange kind of optimism when so much else seems broken.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: At the end of yet another long day indoors, when I want to unwind, I’ll put on the commercial breaks from the 1985 American Music Awards or CBS’s May 3, 1983, broadcast of “The Hunchback of Notre Dame.” I am transported to a magical time, full of smiling faces and hokey jingles, when you could buy a new car for less than $10,000 and Kraft had a line of “Casino” cheeses that were extra mild, in case regular Kraft cheese was too flavorful for you.
2020-06-25.headline_main: In Vintage TV Ads, a Curious Fountain of Hope (and Cheese)

2020-06-25.abstract: The World Health Organization called the end of the country’s 10th outbreak, the second deadliest in history, “a victory for science.” Health workers had faced mistrust and treatment centers were attacked.
2020-06-25.snippet: The World Health Organization called the end of the country’s 10th outbreak, the second deadliest in history, “a victory for science.” Health workers had faced mistrust and treatment centers were attacked.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — The second-worst Ebola outbreak in history is over, the World Health Organization said on Thursday, after nearly two years and 2,280 deaths.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Congo’s Deadliest Ebola Outbreak Is Declared Over

2020-06-25.abstract: Set in Scotland in 1994, the film tells a tender, moody story of friendship.
2020-06-25.snippet: Set in Scotland in 1994, the film tells a tender, moody story of friendship.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Like the party that serves as its climax, the retro teenage-friendship movie “Beats,” set in 1994 in Scotland, owes its appeal to mood and vibe. The soundtrack provides a constant, toe-tapping thump.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘Beats’ Review: A Last Hurrah, and a First Trip

2020-06-25.abstract: Officers were attacked as they attempted to break up an outdoor crowd in the southern district of Brixton, the police said.

2020-06-25.abstract: Tree maps, jazz — and more.
2020-06-25.snippet: Tree maps, jazz — and more.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, we’re sharing things we’re eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every Wednesday. You can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.
2020-06-25.headline_main: The T List: Five Things We Recommend This Week

2020-06-25.abstract: Generation Zers who returned home in March and April represent about $726 million in lost monthly rental revenue, according to a new report.
2020-06-25.snippet: Generation Zers who returned home in March and April represent about $726 million in lost monthly rental revenue, according to a new report.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: A record 32 million American adults were living with their parents or grandparents in April, according to the Current Population Survey from the U.S. Census Bureau, an increase of 9.7 percent over a year ago. The data, analyzed by Zillow researchers, showed that 2.7 million adults moved back home in March and April, and that about 2.2 million of them were aged 18 to 25 — also known as Generation Z.
2020-06-25.headline_main: More Adults Than Ever Live With Parents or Grandparents

2020-06-25.abstract: The museum’s president said visitor numbers could be reduced as much as 80 percent. That might mean a better view of the Mona Lisa, if you can get there.
2020-06-25.snippet: The museum’s president said visitor numbers could be reduced as much as 80 percent. That might mean a better view of the Mona Lisa, if you can get there.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: The Musée du Louvre in Paris is set to reopen on July 6 after a 16-week shutdown that has taken a 40-million-euro toll on its bottom line.
2020-06-25.headline_main: When the Louvre Reopens, It’s Going to Be Quiet

2020-06-25.abstract: More than half of trucks sold in the state must be zero-emissions by 2035, and all of them by 2045.
2020-06-25.snippet: More than half of trucks sold in the state must be zero-emissions by 2035, and all of them by 2045.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Rebuffing strong opposition from industry, California on Thursday adopted a landmark rule requiring more than half of all trucks sold in the state to be zero-emissions by 2035, a move that is expected to improve local air quality, rein in greenhouse gas emissions and sharply curtail the state’s dependence on oil.
2020-06-25.headline_main: New Rule in California Will Require Zero-Emissions Trucks

2020-06-25.abstract: Dentists are donning head-to-toe protective equipment, switching to laser instruments and taking other steps to reassure patients that it’s safe to get back in the chair.
2020-06-25.snippet: Dentists are donning head-to-toe protective equipment, switching to laser instruments and taking other steps to reassure patients that it’s safe to get back in the chair.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: At Dr. Todd Bertman’s office, the receptionist wears a plastic face shield. So do the hygienist and the nine doctors in the practice in Manhattan’s East Village.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Is It Safe to Go Back to the Dentist?

2020-06-25.abstract: Dave Bautista bumbles as a C.I.A. field agent, and has a 9-year-old help him along the way.
2020-06-25.snippet: Dave Bautista bumbles as a C.I.A. field agent, and has a 9-year-old help him along the way.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: In the kind of movie “My Spy” is, comedy is derived from fish-out-of-water scenarios. The flailing fish here is the burly, physically adept C.I.A. field agent JJ (Dave Bautista), who is demoted and left gallivanting around the schoolyard with the 9-year-old girl, Sophie (Chloe Coleman). The plan is to nab Sophie’s nefarious uncle, Marquez (Greg Bryk), who is on the brink of selling nuclear weapons plans to another terrorist. There are pratfalls and dodge ball along the way.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘My Spy’ Review: A Secret Agent Gets Outsmarted

2020-06-25.abstract: A report by the Government Accountability Office criticized the overall federal response to the virus as slow, disorganized and inadequate.
2020-06-25.snippet: A report by the Government Accountability Office criticized the overall federal response to the virus as slow, disorganized and inadequate.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Congress’s watchdog on Thursday criticized the federal government’s response to the coronavirus pandemic, noting that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is inaccurately counting coronavirus tests and that more than $1 billion in payments had been issued to dead people.
2020-06-25.headline_main: $1 Billion in Government Coronavirus Payments Went to Dead People

2020-06-25.abstract: The Brooklyn rapper was on the verge of an international breakthrough when he was killed in February. Here is the story of his whirlwind final months, told by those who knew him best.
2020-06-25.snippet: The Brooklyn rapper was on the verge of an international breakthrough when he was killed in February. Here is the story of his whirlwind final months, told by those who knew him best.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Every so often, though far less frequently than it used to, New York hip-hop mints an ambassador, someone who’s faithful to the grit of the city’s musical legacy while possessing the charisma to transcend it.
2020-06-25.headline_main: The Last Days of Pop Smoke

2020-06-25.abstract: There is now a video intro discussing the film’s much-criticized depictions of the South and slavery, and a panel discussion examining those issues further.
2020-06-25.snippet: There is now a video intro discussing the film’s much-criticized depictions of the South and slavery, and a panel discussion examining those issues further.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: When HBO Max removed the Oscar-winning 1939 adaptation of Margaret Mitchell’s “Gone With the Wind” from its streaming catalog earlier this month, the service promised that the film would return, albeit with “a discussion of its historical context.” On Wednesday, the film quietly resumed its place in that library, and the streamer made good on its promise with two noteworthy additions.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘Gone With the Wind’ Returns to HBO Max With a Few Additions

2020-06-25.abstract: The case concerned a member of Sri Lanka’s Tamil ethnic minority who said he feared persecution and sought to file a petition for a writ of habeas corpus.
2020-06-25.snippet: The case concerned a member of Sri Lanka’s Tamil ethnic minority who said he feared persecution and sought to file a petition for a writ of habeas corpus.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court sided on Thursday with the Trump administration’s efforts to speed the deportation of asylum seekers, ruling that a law limiting the role of federal courts in reviewing those decisions was constitutional.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Supreme Court Says Rejected Asylum Seekers Have No Right to Object in Court

2020-06-25.abstract: Less is more for 2021 weddings. Extravagant nuptials are taking a back seat to intimate, personalized celebrations.
2020-06-25.snippet: Less is more for 2021 weddings. Extravagant nuptials are taking a back seat to intimate, personalized celebrations.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Coronavirus or not, one thing is certain: People will find each other, they will fall in love, and somehow, they will say their vows.
2020-06-25.headline_main: What Will Happen With Weddings?

2020-06-25.abstract: Those bonds forged when you have babies don’t always last.
2020-06-25.snippet: Those bonds forged when you have babies don’t always last.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: L and I connected online, as pregnant women sometimes do. I began reading her blog, and she mine. We met at a downtown café, where we shared a waffle with ice cream, a few weeks after exchanging our first emails. During our pregnancies, we went to the same prenatal education classes — birthing, breastfeeding, infant first aid. We swapped yoga and baby-wearing and infant-clothing resources.
2020-06-25.headline_main: How to Handle a Mom-Friend Breakup

2020-06-25.abstract: The officers in Wilmington, N.C., were fired for misconduct. The recording captured one saying, “We are just going to go out and start slaughtering” black people, according to a report.
2020-06-25.snippet: The officers in Wilmington, N.C., were fired for misconduct. The recording captured one saying, “We are just going to go out and start slaughtering” black people, according to a report.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Three police officers in Wilmington, N.C., were fired after a supervisor found recorded conversations that included racist remarks, slurs and one officer saying he “can’t wait” to start “slaughtering” black people, the department announced Wednesday.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Three N.C. Officers Fired After Police Find Racist Comments on Video

2020-06-25.abstract: The plan encourages guests and staff at Churchill Downs to wear masks, wash their hands and keep their distance from one another in the stands and in the barns.
2020-06-25.snippet: The plan encourages guests and staff at Churchill Downs to wear masks, wash their hands and keep their distance from one another in the stands and in the barns.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: The Kentucky Derby — known for its atmosphere as much as its thoroughbred racing — is keeping its fans this year for betting, mint juleps, and to see and be seen with elaborate millinery and seersucker suits.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Kentucky Derby to Allow Spectators in September

2020-06-25.abstract: As salons and barbershops opened up in the city on Monday, New Yorkers relished the opportunity to freshen up.
2020-06-25.snippet: As salons and barbershops opened up in the city on Monday, New Yorkers relished the opportunity to freshen up.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: For the last three months, I’ve spent my Google Hangout work meetings wearing a Yankees cap. Despite being a born-and-bred New Yorker, I am not a Yankees fan at all. But it was the only cap I had in my house to cover my lack of a shape-up, my lack of a haircut, with barbershops in the city closed because of the pandemic.
2020-06-25.headline_main: 3 Long (Haired) Months: Barbershop Before-and-Afters

2020-06-25.abstract: Shola Amoo’s film is a visually compelling coming-of-age narrative that explores the definition of family.
2020-06-25.snippet: Shola Amoo’s film is a visually compelling coming-of-age narrative that explores the definition of family.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: “The Last Tree,” the visually arresting second feature from Shola Amoo, offers a coming-of-age narrative guided by fluid definitions of family, strains of cultural tension and the quest for personal freedom.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘The Last Tree’ Review: Struggles of a New Life

2020-06-25.abstract: Fossils and modern DNA show the ancient roots of Arctic sled dogs.
2020-06-25.snippet: Fossils and modern DNA show the ancient roots of Arctic sled dogs.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: There are two broad stories about dogs and humans. One is of a deep and meaningful partnership between two species that ensures the survival of both. The other is of scavengers and camp followers that live off our garbage and feed on our corpses in the shadow of war.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Dog Breeding in the Neolithic Age

2020-06-25.abstract: Compared in size with modern black bears, the extinct species offers a new window into the large vombatiforms that once lived in Australia.
2020-06-25.snippet: Compared in size with modern black bears, the extinct species offers a new window into the large vombatiforms that once lived in Australia.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: Wombats and koalas stand out as bizarre animals even in a continent famed for bizarre animals. They are also each other’s closest relatives.

Scientists have mounted air quality monitors on Salt Lake City’s light rail system to create intersection-by-intersection atmospheric profiles.

2020-06-25.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2020-06-25.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: School by Zoom might have been weird and compromised and unsatisfying, true. But now that it’s over and summer looms menacingly ahead with nothing but question marks for parents and kids — Is camp really safe? What about a job at the local mall or movie theater? What are we supposed to doooooo all day? — books are here to help. (Books are always here to help.) For the teens and tweens in my house, distraction has come lately by way of Jonathan Waldman and Rainbow Rowell and Pam Muñoz Ryan; for the parents and kids together, it’s come by way of nightly read-alouds from Philip Pullman’s “His Dark Materials” trilogy.
2020-06-25.headline_main: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week

2020-06-25.snippet: Our culture writers offer suggestions for what to watch or listen to, and how to celebrate Pride Month as it winds down.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: In recent years, at least two major Pride events in New York could be described as part dance party, part arts happening: Everybooty at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, and the House Party at New York Live Arts. This year, when both organizations had to figure out how to celebrate community in a time of social distancing, they decided to make a bigger noise by going online together.

2020-06-25.abstract: Does Steven Spielberg’s 1993 blockbuster, with its ravenous dinosaurs and scientist heroes, still satisfy our hunger for action?
2020-06-25.snippet: Does Steven Spielberg’s 1993 blockbuster, with its ravenous dinosaurs and scientist heroes, still satisfy our hunger for action?
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: What is summer without summer blockbusters? Movie-craving Americans are about to find out. Yes, some theaters are making cautious plans to reopen next month — we’ll see how that goes — but for the first time in forever, we’re facing a Fourth of July weekend without a big popcorn spectacle to provide thrills, laughs, groans, action and air-conditioning. In place of such delights, we decided for our next Weekend Watch to revisit a commercial juggernaut from the past with the hungry dinosaurs and terrified humans of “Jurassic Park.”
2020-06-25.headline_main: Viewing Party! Let’s all Watch ‘Jurassic Park’

2020-06-25.abstract: Jon Stewart’s new political satire, which presents a homespun cliché of Middle America, is a lecture on old news.
2020-06-25.snippet: Jon Stewart’s new political satire, which presents a homespun cliché of Middle America, is a lecture on old news.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: East Coast slickness meets heartland folksiness in “Irresistible,” a political satire so broad and blunt that it flattens every joke and deflates every setup. Movies like this should skip and jab; instead, this second feature from the writer and director Jon Stewart (after his impressively accomplished prison drama, “Rosewater,” in 2014) lumbers and flails. Set shortly after the 2016 election, it feels like an artifact from a particularly contentious past, a stale corn chip trampled into Party-convention carpeting.
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘Irresistible’ Review: The Voters Are Red, the Message Is Blue

2020-06-25.abstract: Sherry Hormann’s new film dramatizes a 2005 “honor killing” in Berlin, using a fictionalized version of the woman who died as narrator.
2020-06-25.snippet: Sherry Hormann’s new film dramatizes a 2005 “honor killing” in Berlin, using a fictionalized version of the woman who died as narrator.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: The drama “A Regular Woman” depicts the true story of Hatun Surucu — known to her friends as Aynur — a German woman of Turkish-Kurdish descent who was shot and killed by her brother in 2005. (The brother who pulled the trigger pleaded guilty in German courts, while two different brothers were recently acquitted of the crime, a so-called honor killing that made international news and inspired an earlier 2011 film.)
2020-06-25.headline_main: ‘A Regular Woman’ Review: A Family Murder, as Told by the Victim

The move could quickly advance sales of bombs to Saudi Arabia, among other deals.

2020-06-25.abstract: The documentary style is eye-opening as it tests the boundaries of nonfiction filmmaking. Try “Crisis” and “Salesman” to start.
2020-06-25.snippet: The documentary style is eye-opening as it tests the boundaries of nonfiction filmmaking. Try “Crisis” and “Salesman” to start.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: For a genre that ostensibly presents snippets of unvarnished truth, a particular type of documentary is difficult to name. The opening of “Chronicle of a Summer” (1961), a groundbreaking example by the anthropologist Jean Rouch and the sociologist Edgar Morin, calls it “cinéma vérité.” To the brothers Albert and David Maysles, it was “direct cinema.” Frederick Wiseman has used the phrase “reality fictions.” But in a 2015 interview, he told me he meant that term in jest: If Truman Capote could describe “In Cold Blood” as a nonfiction novel, then surely Wiseman could say his own films — shot unobtrusively, then edited with an eye toward characterization — added a novelistic spin to reality.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Does Cinéma Vérité Exist? Watch These 2 Movies to Find Out

2020-06-25.abstract: The victims included many farmers working in their fields and children playing outside. At least 83 were reported killed by lightning in the Indian state of Bihar.
2020-06-25.snippet: The victims included many farmers working in their fields and children playing outside. At least 83 were reported killed by lightning in the Indian state of Bihar.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI —  Scores of people died in violent rainstorms in northeastern India on Thursday, including many farmers working in their fields and children playing outside who were killed by lightning strikes, Indian officials said.The storms came as the yearly monsoon rains began in northern India, sweeping across the subcontinent and drenching cities and towns in their path.“Nature’s fury was at its worst today,” said Manoj Kumar Tiwary, a top police official in the state of Bihar, which reported on its Facebook page that 83 people had died of lightning strikes across the state. Officials also reported widespread damage to property across the state.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Lightning and Violent Rainstorms Kill Scores in India

2020-06-25.abstract: About a quarter of banks would near minimum capital levels in a double dip recession, the Fed said, as it announced its stress-test results.
2020-06-25.snippet: About a quarter of banks would near minimum capital levels in a double dip recession, the Fed said, as it announced its stress-test results.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve on Thursday temporarily restricted shareholder payouts by the nation’s biggest banks, barring them from buying back their own stocks or increasing dividend payments in the third quarter as regulators try to ensure banks remain strong enough to keep lending through the pandemic-induced downturn.
2020-06-25.headline_main: Fed Limits Bank Payouts and Suspends Share Buybacks as Pandemic Grinds On

2020-06-25.abstract: Joe Biden took aim at President Trump’s approach to the virus: “It’s all whining and self-pity.” In a separate interview, he said he would require mask-wearing in public if he were president.

2020-06-25.abstract: The device he developed with a colleague in the 1970s has prevented billions of tons of emissions from being spewed by cars, trucks and lawn mowers.

2020-06-25.abstract: Businesses were reopening in recent weeks and oil prices had climbed north of $40 a barrel before coronavirus infections accelerated in the state.

Restaurants and small businesses were opening up in Houston, Dallas and elsewhere. And tens of thousands of people were getting back to work.

2020-06-25.abstract: Mr. Abramoff became the first person charged with violating a law that was amended in response to his previous criminal offenses.

2020-06-25.abstract: In an unusual experiment, researchers found no coronavirus infections among thousands of people allowed to return to their gyms.

Greg Abbott on Thursday hit the pause button, stopping additional phases of the state’s reopening as new coronavirus cases and hospitalizations soared and as the governor struggled to pull off the seemingly impossible task of keeping both the state open and the virus under control.

2020-06-25.abstract: A city with a relatively progressive image and reform-minded police is grappling with a brutal death in police custody — and why it took so long to become public.
2020-06-25.snippet: A city with a relatively progressive image and reform-minded police is grappling with a brutal death in police custody — and why it took so long to become public.
2020-06-25.lead_paragraph: It was another gruesome video of policing in America — a naked Latino man, his face covered by a mesh spit guard, his hands cuffed behind him as he lay dying face down on the ground at his grandmother’s house. He pleaded for water more than a dozen times, saying he could not breathe as police officers restrained his legs and torso.

2020-06-26.abstract: This is not the time to obsess about symbolism.
2020-06-26.snippet: This is not the time to obsess about symbolism.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: There are five gigantic changes happening in America right now. The first is that we are losing the fight against Covid-19. Our behavior doesn’t have anything to do with the reality around us. We just got tired so we’re giving up.
2020-06-26.headline_main: America Is Facing 5 Epic Crises All at Once

2020-06-26.abstract: Federal officials recognized the danger of the spread of coronavirus in prisons early, but have dragged their feet releasing at-risk inmates.
2020-06-26.snippet: Federal officials recognized the danger of the spread of coronavirus in prisons early, but have dragged their feet releasing at-risk inmates.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: The situation inside the nation’s jails and prisons amid the Covid-19 pandemic has become the stuff of nightmares. Overcrowding, unsanitary conditions, shortages of personal protective equipment (not to mention soap) and restrictions on hygiene products such as hand sanitizer have turned detention facilities into a playground for the virus and a death trap for inmates — many of whom, because of age or pre-existing conditions, are at elevated risk for complications. And the threat extends far beyond the facilities themselves, endangering the families and communities that surround prison guards, nurses and other staff members.
2020-06-26.headline_main: The Coronavirus Crisis Inside Prisons Won’t Stay Behind Bars

2020-06-26.abstract: An outlandish suggestion: Wait until Friday night to solve Robyn Weintraub’s excellent puzzle. If you can.
2020-06-26.snippet: An outlandish suggestion: Wait until Friday night to solve Robyn Weintraub’s excellent puzzle. If you can.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: FRIDAY PUZZLE — The New York Times Crossword appears online the evening before its publication date, and I am often asked by readers why that is. The short answer is that, when it was originally offered online, the release of the Crossword was intended to match the time that the first edition of the print paper came out, which was at 10 p.m. Eastern. These days, parts of the print edition are published at different times, but the release of the online Crossword has remained the same.
2020-06-26.headline_main: Taking the High Road

2020-06-26.abstract: With his camera and red arm band, he captured the dark side of Mao’s revolution at great personal risk. Many of the images were stashed under a floor, going undeveloped for years.

He was 79.

2020-06-26.abstract: A sports documentary series debuts on Netflix. And a political satire from Jon Stewart has its virtual premiere.
2020-06-26.snippet: A sports documentary series debuts on Netflix. And a political satire from Jon Stewart has its virtual premiere.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: HOME GAME Stream on Netflix. See athletes risk their lives on several continents — and at sea — in this documentary series, which looks at traditional sports around the globe. These include calcio storico, a centuries-old competition in Florence, Italy, that at once resembles football, rugby and street fighting; kok-boru, a game played in Kyrgyzstan that involves competitors on horseback throwing a goat carcass into a goal; and free diving — in which divers plunge into the ocean without oxygen tanks — in the Philippines. The series’s eight episodes each explore a different sport. They double as character studies of the athletes, including a free-diver who offers a tidy explanation of his passion: “I am happy when I am in the deep.”
2020-06-26.headline_main: What’s on TV Friday: ‘Home Game’ and ‘Irresistible’

2020-06-26.abstract: Authors aren’t allowed mutual reviews in the Book Review anymore, but in the 1950s there was a moment of kismet.
2020-06-26.snippet: Authors aren’t allowed mutual reviews in the Book Review anymore, but in the 1950s there was a moment of kismet.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: At the Book Review, we occasionally delve into our rich archive and discover forgotten gems. In this case, while looking for reviews by James Baldwin, we came across one by Langston Hughes — and then the unusual circumstance that they reviewed each other. In our Feb. 26, 1956 issue Hughes considered Baldwin’s “Notes of a Native Son” and on March 29, 1959  Baldwin returned the volley with a review of Hughes’s “Selected Poems of Langston Hughes.” The writers were mutually harsh but also perceptive about and alive to each other’s creative genius. To read the full text of the reviews, subscribers can visit Times Machine at timesmachine.nytimes.com
2020-06-26.headline_main: When James Baldwin and Langston Hughes Reviewed Each Other

2020-06-26.abstract: Cleaning the house and taking care of children has real economic value, and women have been doing it for free for too long.
2020-06-26.snippet: Cleaning the house and taking care of children has real economic value, and women have been doing it for free for too long.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Women’s shift into paid employment in the 20th century was one of the great economic transformations in recent history. Families began buying goods such as convenience foods, vacuum cleaners and microwaves to substitute for women’s unpaid labor at home. That shift in what households buy was a primary reason for the post-World War II boom in economic growth in the United States and other rich countries.
2020-06-26.headline_main: Why Did It Take a Pandemic to Show How Much Unpaid Work Women Do?

2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Just last month, it looked as if Amy McGrath would coast to the Democratic Senate nomination in Kentucky. A moderate former fighter pilot with strong backing from the party establishment, she had raised over $40 million, far more than all her competitors combined. 2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Good morning. For her Eat column in The Times this week, Tejal Rao talked with Charlotte Rutledge, the manager of the test kitchen at King Arthur Flour, in Norwich, Vt., about the development of the company’s latest hit recipe, for pan pizza (above). It’s worth reading Tejal’s article if you’re at all interested in the painstaking and difficult work of developing recipes that both work and are delicious. And it’s absolutely worth making the recipe this weekend because it’s great.

2020-06-26.abstract: Chain restaurants are rethinking food for diners who fear the virus — and one another.
2020-06-26.snippet: Chain restaurants are rethinking food for diners who fear the virus — and one another.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Go right ahead and leave a cash tip for Debi Kane, a waitress at a TGI Fridays in Corona, Calif. She’ll appreciate the money, but there’s a catch. Under the company’s new pandemic-inspired rules, she will need to drop off those dollars in a back room, then head to a sink, take off her gloves and wash for 20 seconds. Then she’ll wipe her hands with paper towels and wave them in the air for a couple minutes, willing them to dry.
2020-06-26.headline_main: Welcome to Applebee’s! Can I Get You Started With Some Disinfectant?

2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: As coronavirus lockdowns loosen around the world, city leaders are scrambling to address a new problem: the prospect of gridlock worse than before the pandemic. From Shenzhen to Milan to Austin, officials are trying to coax people back onto buses and subways and reclaim road space for cyclists and pedestrians.
2020-06-26.headline_main: How Cities Are Trying to Avert Gridlock After Coronavirus Lockdowns

2020-06-26.abstract: The powered scooter showed the stark contrast between our aspirations for technology and its banal, dysfunctional reality.
2020-06-26.snippet: The powered scooter showed the stark contrast between our aspirations for technology and its banal, dysfunctional reality.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: This week, Segway announced that it will soon stop production of its famous two-wheeled Personal Transporters. It’s very possible that you had already forgotten about the Segway; the company, bought by a Chinese rival in 2015, certainly had, with less than 1.5 percent of its revenue coming from the model.
2020-06-26.headline_main: The Segway Was Meant to Be Much More Than a Sight Gag

2020-06-26.abstract: “The fact I am here means I am descended from people who, even enslaved, did not give up hope.”
2020-06-26.snippet: “The fact I am here means I am descended from people who, even enslaved, did not give up hope.”
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — This, an old saying goes, is “the city too busy to hate,” one of the few places in America where enlightened leaders, black and white, chose prosperity over prejudice and a large black middle class emerged decades ago. Birthplace of Martin Luther King Jr., cradle of the civil rights movement, Atlanta, with its gleaming towers and porch swings, was an American exception. The city managed racial conflict through compromise. It was the black mecca. Or so the story went.
2020-06-26.headline_main: ‘Let Freedom Ring’ From Georgia

2020-06-26.abstract: A bear that mauled two men in northeastern Italy is due to be euthanized if it can be identified. Activists say it deserves a day in court, at least of public opinion.

2020-06-26.headline_main: After Death Warrant for Bear, Animal Rights Groups Demand Fair Trial

A minute later, as Garcia ascended a hill, the only sound was his pencil scratching a last number on a scorecard.

2020-06-26.headline_main: Starting Bonus for a Laundry Worker: How a Beach Town Wrestles With Jobless Benefits

2020-06-26.abstract: On the band’s third album, the sisters in Haim add what was missing from previous releases — tension and texture — to make their sharpest and most adventurous songs yet.
2020-06-26.snippet: On the band’s third album, the sisters in Haim add what was missing from previous releases — tension and texture — to make their sharpest and most adventurous songs yet.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Haim makes music of forward momentum, soundtracks for strutting confidently away from trouble. Its most memorable videos feature the trio’s members — the sisters Alana, Danielle and Este Haim — marching in loose lock step with one another, occasionally bursting into playful choreography. It’s a visual trope that lets them have some revisionist fun with girl group iconography, but it’s also a natural extension of their percussive sound. “We like rhythm,” Danielle said in a 2013 interview, after the release of their debut album, “Days Are Gone.” “It’s all these parts interlocking.”
2020-06-26.headline_main: Haim Steps Into a New Groove on ‘Women in Music Pt. III’

2020-06-26.abstract: This 30-minute dinner gets its crunch from pan-seared tofu, blistered snap peas and toasted cashews, and its flavor from an umami-rich sauce.
2020-06-26.snippet: This 30-minute dinner gets its crunch from pan-seared tofu, blistered snap peas and toasted cashews, and its flavor from an umami-rich sauce.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Tofu’s versatility is no secret, but to embrace its many uses is an exquisite thing — it can be pan-fried, grilled, blended into spreads and dressings, or tossed in a smoker for a few hours. Those who know tofu well understand it as an ingredient that is subtle and ever-so-slightly sweet, a willing canvas for flavors or a base for them to intermingle.
2020-06-26.headline_main: This One-Pan Meal Shows Just How Joyful Tofu Can Be

2020-06-26.abstract: With pubs and restaurants still closed in a country that has the world’s third-highest reported coronavirus death toll, crowds have flocked to beaches, parks and streams this week.

They attacked police officers who tried to disperse illegal block parties. And hundreds became stuck in mud flats while trying to reach the sea at low tide.

2020-06-26.abstract: Embrace greens with these herby, verdant dinners.
2020-06-26.snippet: Embrace greens with these herby, verdant dinners.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Hello and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. My quarantine diet has shifted considerably in recent weeks: I now have way more access to fresh greens, which has meant salads galore. This windfall has reminded me that a great salad is a true luxury. (I am also devouring berries, fresh and baked into desserts like Jerrelle Guy’s strawberry spoon cake, an instant classic that is even easier to make than this famously easy plum torte. I served my spoon cake with ice cream and basil.)
2020-06-26.headline_main: Fresh and Satisfying

2020-06-26.abstract: In these four deeply unsettling novels, nothing is as it seems.
2020-06-26.snippet: In these four deeply unsettling novels, nothing is as it seems.
2020-06-26.lead_paragraph: Summer is full upon us, and what we need most are thrillers to take us out of our own heads. Along comes THIS LITTLE FAMILY (Other Press, 264 pp., paper, $15.99), a short, sharp debut by the French author Inès Bayard, which has murder in its first paragraph. Marie, a young Parisian mother, laces a lovingly prepared meal with poison and feeds it to her husband and her toddler before eating it herself. The worst part, perhaps, is that one of them survives.
2020-06-26.headline_main: Psychological Thrillers That Will Mess With Your Head

Many of them felt awkward, unsure. They had never done this before. Some wanted to leave the field as soon as possible; all they had done was draw at home with West Bromwich Albion. The point they had earned had moved them up to ninth in the Premier League table.

Today’s grid isn’t laid out that strangely, but it has nine debuts, many of them tough, and some excellent cluing that also adds to the challenge. I had a bit of trouble breaking in, but I would say that this is a puzzle that runs once you’ve built the momentum.

2020-06-27.abstract: Netflix’s twisty time-travel drama returns for a third and final season, and Dwayne Johnson hosts a concert to raise awareness for coronavirus relief.
2020-06-27.snippet: Netflix’s twisty time-travel drama returns for a third and final season, and Dwayne Johnson hosts a concert to raise awareness for coronavirus relief.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: DARK Stream on Netflix. This incredibly complex and inventive German sci-fi series starts out as so many other mystery thrillers do, with the disappearance of young boy. But as the series progresses, the mystery surrounding the boy, who vanished in a forest, grows deeper and more bizarre — involving time travel, an apocalyptic event, a secretive society and the existence of multiple universes. The series, which returns for a third and final season, focuses on the secrets and intertwined histories of four local families, spanning multiple generations. As much as the show is a heady, brain-bending exploration into the physics and ethics of time travel, it also poses some thought-provoking questions concerning the nature of free will.
2020-06-27.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘Dark’ and a Star-Studded Global Citizen Concert

Experts note that you can perform most standard exercises there if you’re willing to use your imagination — you can even recruit your children to help as giggling, resistance-adding workout partners. What follows are a few moves for a full-body, sun-drenched routine. (Wear a face mask, observe social distancing and use gloves or hand sanitizer to protect yourself and others, of course.)

2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Watching athletes compete in the Summer Olympic Games is a long-awaited highlight for millions around the world. It’s a ritual that comes every four years — a chance to escape the heat, crank up the air conditioning and watch televised events like basketball games, track-and-field relays and table tennis matches. But with the coronavirus outbreak forcing the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo to be postponed, viewers will have to wait another year.

2020-06-27.snippet: Getting your feet sandal-ready can be done at home. Men, you can pay attention, too.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: After months of shoving your feet into thick, slouchy socks — and boots, if you ventured out — it’s past time for your toes to see a little sunlight. But they’re likely to need at least a little T.L.C., lest you risk offending the members of your quarantine pod. Follow this step-by-step (no pun intended) guide to give yourself a safe summer pedicure. And, yes, these instructions can also be followed by the manliest of readers.

2020-06-27.abstract: Targeted killings and widespread attacks across Afghanistan have sapped brief optimism as peace talks remain stalled.
2020-06-27.snippet: Targeted killings and widespread attacks across Afghanistan have sapped brief optimism as peace talks remain stalled.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Two employees of Afghanistan’s human rights commission were killed in Kabul on Saturday as a bomb attached to their vehicle exploded, the latest in a rising number of targeted killings in the Afghan capital.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Afghan Deaths Pile Up in Uncertainty Over U.S. Deal With Taliban

2020-06-27.abstract: As French soccer closed down, one club executive complained the loudest. Now, as other European soccer leagues have resumed, Jean-Michel Aulas is doubling down.
2020-06-27.snippet: As French soccer closed down, one club executive complained the loudest. Now, as other European soccer leagues have resumed, Jean-Michel Aulas is doubling down.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Jean-Michel Aulas has been watching a lot of soccer in recent weeks. His emotions have been mixed.
2020-06-27.headline_main: French Soccer’s Renegade President Would Like a Word. With Everyone.

2020-06-27.abstract: Exhausted and angry as they face a series of crises, many voters nevertheless remain optimistic about the future, a poll shows, viewing this moment as a chance for progress, one they can help shape.
2020-06-27.snippet: Exhausted and angry as they face a series of crises, many voters nevertheless remain optimistic about the future, a poll shows, viewing this moment as a chance for progress, one they can help shape.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Amanda Vibelius, a stay-at-home mother in rural Arizona, is angry and overwhelmed.
2020-06-27.headline_main: How Americans Feel About the Country Right Now: Anxious. Hopeful.

2020-06-27.abstract: Erin Entrada Kelly’s “We Dream of Space” follows three siblings, adrift in a dysfunctional family, as they await the shuttle Challenger’s liftoff.
2020-06-27.snippet: Erin Entrada Kelly’s “We Dream of Space” follows three siblings, adrift in a dysfunctional family, as they await the shuttle Challenger’s liftoff.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: It’s January 1986. What do you do if you’re a 12-year-old girl who feels invisible and longs to be a space shuttle commander? In Erin Entrada Kelly’s WE DREAM OF SPACE (Greenwillow, 400 pp., $16.99; ages 8 to 12), Bernadatte Nelson Thomas (known as Bird) daydreams she’s reaching out to Judith Resnik, an astronaut prepping for the launch of the Challenger. An imaginary Resnik talks back, telling Bird, “You’re not disappearing,” and describes being in space as “floating in a world that belongs only to you, but also belongs to everyone else.”
2020-06-27.headline_main: Preparing to Launch: Three Adolescents Count Down to Adulthood

2020-06-27.abstract: In Jenny Torres Sanchez’ “We Are Not From Here,” three Guatemalan teenagers embark on a harrowing journey through Mexico to the U.S. border.
2020-06-27.snippet: In Jenny Torres Sanchez’ “We Are Not From Here,” three Guatemalan teenagers embark on a harrowing journey through Mexico to the U.S. border.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: WE ARE NOT FROM HERE (Philomel, 368 pp., $17.99; ages 14 and up), by Jenny Torres Sanchez, is a novel precisely for this moment.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Brave Teenage Refugees Seek a Home of the Free

2020-06-27.abstract: Strawberry drop biscuits, sausage and peppers pasta, and more.
2020-06-27.snippet: Strawberry drop biscuits, sausage and peppers pasta, and more.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: The week’s most popular dishes include Samantha Seneviratne’s Key lime pie bars with vanilla wafer crust (above), Tejal Rao’s cheesy pan pizza and Kay Chun’s sausage and peppers pasta with broccoli. Find more recipes in the collection below.
2020-06-27.headline_main: The Tangiest Key Lime Pie Bars

2020-06-27.abstract: The former governor has faltered in a primary campaign for a seat that is essential for Democrats to capture if they hope to retake the Senate majority.
2020-06-27.snippet: The former governor has faltered in a primary campaign for a seat that is essential for Democrats to capture if they hope to retake the Senate majority.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: KREMMLING, Colo. — For months, Democrats have figured that Colorado’s U.S. Senate race, a linchpin of their strategy to take back the majority in November, was essentially in the bag, with the Republican incumbent Cory Gardner trailing by double digits behind their candidate John Hickenlooper, the well-liked and well-known former two-term governor and Denver mayor.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Hickenlooper Stumbles in Colorado Race, Complicating Democrats’ Senate Push

2020-06-27.abstract: For both parties, taking action to reduce the cost of prescription drugs was a banner policy issue before the coronavirus outbreak. Does it still have a chance?
2020-06-27.snippet: For both parties, taking action to reduce the cost of prescription drugs was a banner policy issue before the coronavirus outbreak. Does it still have a chance?
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump visited Senate Republicans last month for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic began ripping across the country, Senator Charles E. Grassley, the powerful chairman of the Finance Committee, confronted him about whether he still wanted to fulfill his years-old promise of lowering the cost of prescription drugs.
2020-06-27.headline_main: As the Coronavirus Spreads, Drug Pricing Legislation Remains Stalled

2020-06-27.abstract: As Covid-19 cases surge, it is clear many governors underestimated the coronavirus and rushed to reopen before their states were ready.
2020-06-27.snippet: As Covid-19 cases surge, it is clear many governors underestimated the coronavirus and rushed to reopen before their states were ready.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — More than four months into fighting the coronavirus in the United States, the shared sacrifice of millions of Americans suspending their lives — with jobs lost, businesses shuttered, daily routines upended — has not been enough to beat back a virus whose staying power around the world is only still being grasped.
2020-06-27.headline_main: After Asking Americans to Sacrifice in Shutdown, Leaders Failed to Control Virus

2020-06-27.abstract: Richard Silvestri returns and shakes our cryptic confidence.
2020-06-27.snippet: Richard Silvestri returns and shakes our cryptic confidence.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: CRYPTIC CROSSWORD — Today’s cryptic was slow going for me, probably because there are hardly any anagrams, and I lean on them for letters. I found the southeast corner extremely tough! However, the effort’s very worthwhile and there are some really interesting and unusual entries, once you’ve sorted your way through the multiple steps in most of the clues.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Variety: Cryptic Crossword

2020-06-27.abstract: The cutting of a beloved tree felled my heart. Then a bird came.
2020-06-27.snippet: The cutting of a beloved tree felled my heart. Then a bird came.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: I bought my house in Oregon without ever having set foot in it, without ever having even been to the state. I bought it knowing I might never make it here, that I’d have to risk my life to try. In my rowhouse in the clatter of Washington, D.C., my only view was the back of another house, about as far as I’d ever been able to see during years spent largely housebound with an illness that was finally beginning to let me go.
2020-06-27.headline_main: I Was in Love With a Tree That Swallowed the Sky

2020-06-27.abstract: Prison officials did everything they could to prevent a coronavirus outbreak. Everything except release prisoners.
2020-06-27.snippet: Prison officials did everything they could to prevent a coronavirus outbreak. Everything except release prisoners.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: GRAFTON, Ohio — A few of us were talking at Roc and Dave’s bunk about writing a petition about keeping inmates safe during the pandemic. Suggestions of what to include were trickling in throughout the long, dragging day — through in-depth conversations or notes passed under the cell door.
2020-06-27.headline_main: We Would Die of the Virus or Not. The System Would Roll On.

2020-06-27.abstract: State election officials face shortages of money, poll workers, capacity to print ballots and public trust — without much time to fix them.
2020-06-27.snippet: State election officials face shortages of money, poll workers, capacity to print ballots and public trust — without much time to fix them.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Evelina Reese has been a poll worker for 40 years. And for the last six decades, she says, she has never missed a chance to vote.
2020-06-27.headline_main: From 47 Primaries, 4 Warning Signs About the 2020 Vote

2020-06-27.abstract: Readers discuss plans to remove the Teddy Roosevelt statue in front of the Museum of Natural History and controversies over other monuments.
2020-06-27.snippet: Readers discuss plans to remove the Teddy Roosevelt statue in front of the Museum of Natural History and controversies over other monuments.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Removing the Statues (T.R. and Others)

2020-06-27.abstract: Much of the country is reopening, even as in some places the number of Covid-19 cases is rising. The idea of stepping out of isolation makes some people anxious.
2020-06-27.snippet: Much of the country is reopening, even as in some places the number of Covid-19 cases is rising. The idea of stepping out of isolation makes some people anxious.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Across the country, cities and states are in various stages of reopening, even as cases of Covid-19 are rising, particularly in the South. Some people are lounging at the beach, without masks, or going out to eat and drink in restaurants and bars, where social distancing may be difficult.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Gotten Used to Quarantine? Us Too

2020-06-27.abstract: She performed some of the most powerful songs in that show, which ran for more than four years in Greenwich Village and became a theater staple.
2020-06-27.snippet: She performed some of the most powerful songs in that show, which ran for more than four years in Greenwich Village and became a theater staple.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Elly Stone, who was enjoying a moderately successful career as a singer and actress when she jumped to a new level of fame in 1968 as part of the wildly popular musical revue “Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris,” died on June 11 in Cuenca, Ecuador. She was 93.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Elly Stone, 93, Distinctive Singer in ‘Jacques Brel’ Revue, Dies

2020-06-27.abstract: University trustees concluded that Wilson’s “racist thinking and policies make him an inappropriate namesake for a school or college,” Princeton’s president said on Saturday.
2020-06-27.snippet: University trustees concluded that Wilson’s “racist thinking and policies make him an inappropriate namesake for a school or college,” Princeton’s president said on Saturday.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Princeton University will remove Woodrow Wilson’s name from its public policy school and one of its residential colleges, the university’s president said on Saturday — a move that comes four years after it decided to keep the name over the objections of student protests.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Princeton Will Remove Woodrow Wilson’s Name From School

2020-06-27.abstract: The N.H.L. held the first of two lotteries to determine the 2020 draft order but, in a confounding reveal, did not name the team that will select first over all.
2020-06-27.snippet: The N.H.L. held the first of two lotteries to determine the 2020 draft order but, in a confounding reveal, did not name the team that will select first over all.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: The National Hockey League on Friday held the first part of its draft lottery, an annual ritual of pro sports leagues meant to lay out an order of business for the rest of the draft process. The night’s primary revelation, however, was that this year’s draft order is still as incomplete as the season itself.
2020-06-27.headline_main: The First Pick in the N.H.L. Draft Goes to … TBD

2020-06-27.abstract: The country’s nationalist governing party has found itself in a spirited fight, as new circumstances harden old divisions.
2020-06-27.snippet: The country’s nationalist governing party has found itself in a spirited fight, as new circumstances harden old divisions.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Poland’s governing party swept to power five years ago by appealing to a sense of aggrieved nationalism, and moved quickly to transform the state in ways that critics contend has torn at the fragile fabric of its democracy.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Poland’s Virus-Delayed Presidential Election Suddenly Looks Tight

2020-06-27.abstract: Many gig-based business models help customers take advantage of workers. Let’s stop giving tech companies a free ride.
2020-06-27.snippet: Many gig-based business models help customers take advantage of workers. Let’s stop giving tech companies a free ride.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: The underpinning of countless Silicon Valley success stories is a method of commerce that treats millions of workers as disposable and deprives them of protections regular employees enjoy, like employer-paid health care. Keeping Uber drivers and DoorDash food couriers classified as contractors saves the companies billions in costs and has helped fuel billions more in investor value.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Uber Rides Cost More? OK

2020-06-27.abstract: The prevalence of infections is more than 10 times higher than the counted number of cases in six regions of the United States.
2020-06-27.snippet: The prevalence of infections is more than 10 times higher than the counted number of cases in six regions of the United States.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: The number of coronavirus infections in many parts of the United States is more than 10 times higher than the reported rate, according to data released on Friday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Actual Coronavirus Infections Vastly Undercounted, C.D.C. Data Shows

2020-06-27.abstract: Coaches, athletes, country music stars and the Baptist Convention have called for changing the flag that symbolizes the state’s Confederate past.
2020-06-27.snippet: Coaches, athletes, country music stars and the Baptist Convention have called for changing the flag that symbolizes the state’s Confederate past.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Update: In a ceremony on Tuesday evening, Gov. Tate Reeves of Mississippi signed into law the legislation replacing the state flag.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Mississippi Lawmakers Push Ahead With Proposal to Take Down State Flag

2020-06-27.abstract: At Stanford, he created the world’s first successful sleep clinic and taught a popular class on sleep and dreams. (If he caught students dozing, he’d wake them with a water gun.)
2020-06-27.snippet: At Stanford, he created the world’s first successful sleep clinic and taught a popular class on sleep and dreams. (If he caught students dozing, he’d wake them with a water gun.)
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Dr. William Dement, whose introduction to the mysteries of slumber as a postgraduate student in the 1950s led him to become an eminent researcher of sleep disorders and to preach the benefits of a good night’s sleep, died on June 17 in Stanford, Calif. He was 91.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Dr. William Dement, Leader in Sleep Disorder Research, Dies at 91

2020-06-27.abstract: Things are looking down for the Donald.
2020-06-27.snippet: Things are looking down for the Donald.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For a long time, Republicans have brandished the same old narrative to try to scare their way into the White House.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Trump, Not So Statuesque

2020-06-27.abstract: The “Hispanic paradox” could offer a model for civil society.
2020-06-27.snippet: The “Hispanic paradox” could offer a model for civil society.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: CORNELIUS, Ore. — Scholars call it the “Hispanic Paradox”: Despite poverty and discrimination, Hispanic Americans live significantly longer than white or black Americans.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Now Is a Time to Learn From Hispanic Americans

2020-06-27.abstract: The suspended time of the pandemic has put history on fast-forward.
2020-06-27.snippet: The suspended time of the pandemic has put history on fast-forward.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: There is something peculiar about time during the pandemic. On the one hand there’s a feeling that the normal calendar has simply stopped, school schedules and sports seasons evaporating, one homebound day passing much like another. It’s a feeling of hiatus, intermission, like the days between Christmas and the new year, or some extra season invented by a Renaissance pope to fix a lagging calendar.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Waking Up in 2030

2020-06-27.abstract: She, more than anyone, can get under Trump’s skin.
2020-06-27.snippet: She, more than anyone, can get under Trump’s skin.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: Whatever his wobbles, Joe Biden has, from the start of his presidential campaign, got one thing exactly right: The 2020 election is a battle for the soul of America. That’s not just a pretty slogan. It’s the stomach-knotting truth — and it’s the frame he should use for choosing his running mate.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Biden’s Best Veep Pick Is Obvious

2020-06-27.abstract: The city’s food bank has been a lifeline and a source of hope for many across Southwest Texas.
2020-06-27.snippet: The city’s food bank has been a lifeline and a source of hope for many across Southwest Texas.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO — Austin Wondzell’s midnight blue S.U.V. was one of the nearly 2,000 vehicles winding through a stadium parking lot on a Friday morning in mid-May.
2020-06-27.headline_main: ‘San Antonio Strong’

2020-06-27.abstract: Jon Schneider and Anderson Wang collaborate on a lofty Sunday debut.
2020-06-27.snippet: Jon Schneider and Anderson Wang collaborate on a lofty Sunday debut.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Today’s puzzle is a bicoastal double debut from Jon Schneider, a research scientist at Google in New York City, and Anderson Wang, a software engineer in California. The two met at M.I.T. and bonded over solving and constructing together. (Shout out to any zoom or skype group solvers out there! What a world.)
2020-06-27.headline_main: Power-Ups

2020-06-27.abstract: The Emancipation Memorial, intended to commemorate the end of slavery, has prompted a thorny debate over what the interaction between the two figures conveys.
2020-06-27.snippet: The Emancipation Memorial, intended to commemorate the end of slavery, has prompted a thorny debate over what the interaction between the two figures conveys.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: As communities across the country reconsider statues and monuments of historical figures, protesters in Washington, D.C., are increasing calls to remove the Emancipation Memorial, a statue of a freed slave crouching before President Abraham Lincoln, after attempts in the past week to tear it down have intensified the debate over its value.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Activists Push for Removal of Statue of Freed Slave Kneeling Before Lincoln

2020-06-27.abstract: A novel gene-editing experiment seems to have permanently reduced LDL and triglyceride levels in monkeys.
2020-06-27.snippet: A novel gene-editing experiment seems to have permanently reduced LDL and triglyceride levels in monkeys.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: What if a single injection could lower blood levels of cholesterol and triglycerides — for a lifetime?
2020-06-27.headline_main: A ‘Cure for Heart Disease’? A Single Shot Succeeds in Monkeys

2020-06-27.abstract: A woman who was not wearing a mask griped on Facebook about the barista, who had tried to explain company policy. Her post unexpectedly led to an outpouring of money for the worker.
2020-06-27.snippet: A woman who was not wearing a mask griped on Facebook about the barista, who had tried to explain company policy. Her post unexpectedly led to an outpouring of money for the worker.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: A Starbucks barista in San Diego has more than $87,000 to fuel his dream of teaching dance after an online fund-raiser was created in response to a Facebook post by a customer who was not wearing a mask complaining about him and the company’s policies.
2020-06-27.headline_main: Starbucks Barista Gets $87,000 in Donations After Customer’s Mask Complaint

2020-06-27.abstract: In Texas’ most populous county, officials are again urging people to stay home, saying this flood of cases will be worse than the last one.
2020-06-27.snippet: In Texas’ most populous county, officials are again urging people to stay home, saying this flood of cases will be worse than the last one.
2020-06-27.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Alex Belt, a single mother of three girls and the owner of Silly Silly Girls gift boutique, has a succinct way of describing her life in Houston as officials warn of an alarming spike in coronavirus cases: “Business as usual without the business.”
2020-06-27.headline_main: Houston Moves to ‘Severe’ Covid Warning. Will Enough People Listen?

2020-06-28.abstract: Mr. Biden released figures on Saturday after facing questions about racial diversity at the upper echelons of his campaign.
2020-06-28.snippet: Mr. Biden released figures on Saturday after facing questions about racial diversity at the upper echelons of his campaign.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. released statistics on the diversity of his presidential campaign staff on Saturday evening, announcing that 35 percent of his full-time staff members and 36 percent of his full-time senior staff members are people of color.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Biden Campaign Says Just Over a Third of 2020 Staff Members Are People of Color

2020-06-28.abstract: An employee at the center in Red Bluff, Calif., said he had heard 50 to 60 shots as he and other employees fled the building.
2020-06-28.snippet: An employee at the center in Red Bluff, Calif., said he had heard 50 to 60 shots as he and other employees fled the building.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: A shooting on Saturday by a former worker at a Walmart distribution center in Red Bluff, Calif., left an employee dead and several others injured, the authorities said.
2020-06-28.headline_main: 2 Dead in Shooting at Walmart Distribution Center in California, Including Gunman

2020-06-28.abstract: Mississippi state legislators voted, 85 to 34, to remove the state’s flag from its Capitol and begin creating a new flag that no longer contains the Confederate battle emblem.
2020-06-28.snippet: Mississippi state legislators voted, 85 to 34, to remove the state’s flag from its Capitol and begin creating a new flag that no longer contains the Confederate battle emblem.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Mississippi state legislators voted, 85 to 34, to remove the state’s flag from its Capitol and begin creating a new flag that no longer contains the Confederate battle emblem.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Mississippi Votes to Remove Confederate Emblem From State Flag

2020-06-28.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, June 28, 2020.
2020-06-28.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, June 28, 2020.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: “We have a flag. It’s the United States flag. I’m cool with that one.”
2020-06-28.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: For Black NASCAR Fans, It Can Be Lonely at the Track

2020-06-28.abstract: The White House denied that President Trump was briefed on the classified assessment, even though his staff has been discussing the matter since March.
2020-06-28.snippet: The White House denied that President Trump was briefed on the classified assessment, even though his staff has been discussing the matter since March.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. assailed President Trump on Saturday for failing to punish Russia for offering bounties to the Taliban to kill American troops in Afghanistan, while the White House denied that Mr. Trump had been briefed on the months-old classified intelligence assessment about Russia’s activities.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Biden Criticizes Trump Over Intelligence on Russian Bounties on U.S. Troops

2020-06-28.abstract: Chinese lawmakers have approved the law, threatening to curb free speech and protest in Hong Kong after a year of political tumult.
2020-06-28.snippet: Chinese lawmakers have approved the law, threatening to curb free speech and protest in Hong Kong after a year of political tumult.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Chinese lawmakers have approved a national security law, drastically curbing political protest and dissent in Hong Kong and adding to Beijing’s tensions with Western powers.
2020-06-28.headline_main: What China’s New National Security Law Means for Hong Kong

2020-06-28.abstract: Video footage showed a man firing more than a dozen shots at a park in Louisville, Ky., where demonstrators were protesting Ms. Taylor’s shooting death by the police in March.
2020-06-28.snippet: Video footage showed a man firing more than a dozen shots at a park in Louisville, Ky., where demonstrators were protesting Ms. Taylor’s shooting death by the police in March.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: A fatal shooting in Louisville on Saturday night added a grim note to weeks of protests against police violence and particularly against the killing there in March of Breonna Taylor, an African-American emergency room technician shot to death by police in her home.
2020-06-28.headline_main: 1 Dead After Man Shoots Into Crowd at Breonna Taylor Protest Site

2020-06-28.abstract: Tune into the 20th annual BET Awards, or watch a true crime documentary series on HBO.
2020-06-28.snippet: Tune into the 20th annual BET Awards, or watch a true crime documentary series on HBO.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: 2020 BET AWARDS 8 p.m. on BET and CBS. While some awards have postponed their ceremonies, this annual show, which celebrates the work of black artists, athletes and entertainers, is still a go. Now in its 20th year, the BET Awards will feature performances by Alicia Keys, Future, DaBaby and more. Rather than sing from their couches, the artists prerecorded their own segments from all sorts of settings, using open venues, public spaces and, of course, their creativity. Drake leads with six nominations, followed by Megan Thee Stallion and Roddy Rich, who each have five. Other artists with multiple nods include Beyoncé, Nicki Minaj and Chris Brown. The comedian Amanda Seales hosts.
2020-06-28.headline_main: What’s on TV Sunday: The BET Awards and ‘I’ll Be Gone in the Dark’

2020-06-28.abstract: Saving a parking space, an empty seat on a crowded bus and more reader tales of New York City in this week’s Metropolitan Diary.
2020-06-28.snippet: Saving a parking space, an empty seat on a crowded bus and more reader tales of New York City in this week’s Metropolitan Diary.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2020-06-28.headline_main: ‘We Noticed a Man Who Was Standing in the Street Near the Curb’

2020-06-28.abstract: Migrants say Houthi militias that control northern Yemen are brutally forcing them out of their territory and into dangerous situations.
2020-06-28.snippet: Migrants say Houthi militias that control northern Yemen are brutally forcing them out of their territory and into dangerous situations.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — The Yemeni militiamen rumbled up to the settlement of Al Ghar in the morning, firing their machine guns at the Ethiopian migrants caught in the middle of somebody else’s war. They shouted at the migrants: Take your coronavirus and leave the country, or face death.
2020-06-28.headline_main: African Migrants in Yemen Scapegoated for Coronavirus Outbreak

2020-06-28.abstract: “Sex and Vanity,” Kwan’s new novel, updates E.M. Forster’s classic with a multinational cast and a lot less restraint.
2020-06-28.snippet: “Sex and Vanity,” Kwan’s new novel, updates E.M. Forster’s classic with a multinational cast and a lot less restraint.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: It’s been seven years since Kevin Kwan’s “Crazy Rich Asians” took the world of escapist shopaholic fantasy by storm. That was so long ago that Kwan’s funniest Hong Kong arriviste, Eddie Chen, could use Astor, Trump and Vanderbilt as the names of his dogs. That book, which grew into a wildly popular trilogy and film franchise, made the Marie Antoinette-ing of the Singaporean superrich both freakish and fascinating. So much about the extravagance and snobbery of the book’s clashing Asian elites was not globally known.
2020-06-28.headline_main: When the Room With a View Is Kevin Kwan’s, Things Might Get Wild

2020-06-28.abstract: No Democrat has won or broken even with voters over 65 in two decades. But seniors’ dismay about President Trump could change that.
2020-06-28.snippet: No Democrat has won or broken even with voters over 65 in two decades. But seniors’ dismay about President Trump could change that.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Clifford Wagner, an 80-year-old Republican in Tucson, Ariz., never cared for President Trump.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Trump Faces Mounting Defections From a Once-Loyal Group: Older White Voters

2020-06-28.abstract: A lawyer for the former national security adviser turned to the attorney general for help, and he delivered, months before a pair of appellate judges handed Mr. Flynn another legal victory.
2020-06-28.snippet: A lawyer for the former national security adviser turned to the attorney general for help, and he delivered, months before a pair of appellate judges handed Mr. Flynn another legal victory.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Sidney Powell, a firebrand lawyer whose pugnacious Fox News appearances had earned her numerous private phone conversations with President Trump, sent a letter last year to Attorney General William P. Barr about her soon-to-be new client, Michael T. Flynn.
2020-06-28.headline_main: How Michael Flynn’s Defense Team Found Powerful Allies

2020-06-28.abstract: Opening bars and bringing back football teams have led to new outbreaks. Communities that evolved around campuses face potentially existential losses in population, jobs and revenue.
2020-06-28.snippet: Opening bars and bringing back football teams have led to new outbreaks. Communities that evolved around campuses face potentially existential losses in population, jobs and revenue.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: DAVIS, Calif. — The community around the University of California, Davis, used to have a population of 70,000 and a thriving economy. Rentals were tight. Downtown was jammed. Hotels were booked months in advance for commencement. Students swarmed to the town’s bar crawl, sampling the trio of signature cocktails known on campus as “the Davis Trinity.”
2020-06-28.headline_main: ‘We Could Be Feeling This for the Next Decade’: Virus Hits College Towns

2020-06-28.abstract: For many young athletes, senior night is the last act of the last season of their high school careers, and their days as competitive athletes. But how do you celebrate after the coronavirus rewrites the story?
2020-06-28.snippet: For many young athletes, senior night is the last act of the last season of their high school careers, and their days as competitive athletes. But how do you celebrate after the coronavirus rewrites the story?
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: UNION, N.J. — At high schools across America, senior night is bittersweet even in the best of times. This year, it became just another milestone, alongside senior proms and graduation ceremonies, erased from the calendar by the coronavirus pandemic.
2020-06-28.headline_main: The Lost Spring

2020-06-28.abstract: Two researchers have studied political expression on the app since the Musical.ly era. Here’s what they found.
2020-06-28.snippet: Two researchers have studied political expression on the app since the Musical.ly era. Here’s what they found.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: As a place where millions of young Americans perform and explore their identities in public, TikTok has become a prominent venue for ideological formation, political activism and trolling. It has homegrown pundits, and despite its parent company’s reluctance to be involved with politics — the service does not allow political ads — it has attracted interest from campaigns. It is also a space where people can be gathered and pressed into action quickly.
2020-06-28.headline_main: TikTok Is Shaping Politics. But How?

2020-06-28.abstract: Coronavirus cases are spiking in states that reopened quickly, threatening the country’s economic recovery.
2020-06-28.snippet: Coronavirus cases are spiking in states that reopened quickly, threatening the country’s economic recovery.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Have a safe and socially distanced July Fourth. You know the rules, annoying as they are. And fresh outbreaks in many states prove the dangers of wishful thinking. Here’s what else you need to know for the week ahead in business and tech.
