2020-06-28.abstract: Make a vegan ranch dressing, from Superiority Burger in New York, and use it to top roasted potatoes, grilled romaine or even your next burger.
2020-06-28.snippet: Make a vegan ranch dressing, from Superiority Burger in New York, and use it to top roasted potatoes, grilled romaine or even your next burger.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Good morning. A number of years ago, my friend and colleague Tejal Rao met up with a sous chef named Julia Goldberg at the vegetarian restaurant Superiority Burger in New York, where Goldberg then worked. Tejal had come to learn the secrets of one of Goldberg’s most elegant creations: A vegan ranch dressing (above), “tangy and creamy,” Tejal wrote for The Times, “turbocharged with the familiar mouth-smacking umami of bottled ranch.”
2020-06-28.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2020-06-28.abstract: The work of Hu Jie, who has made more than 30 movies, is little known even in China. The release of “Spark” and “The Observer” should make him better known abroad.
2020-06-28.snippet: The work of Hu Jie, who has made more than 30 movies, is little known even in China. The release of “Spark” and “The Observer” should make him better known abroad.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: For more than 20 years, the filmmaker Hu Jie has been trawling the deep waters of Chinese history to create a series of harrowing documentaries about the early years of Communist Party rule.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Excavating Chinese History, One Harrowing Film at a Time

2020-06-28.abstract: History is repeating itself as pools, beaches and clubs open — but mostly for the privileged few.
2020-06-28.snippet: History is repeating itself as pools, beaches and clubs open — but mostly for the privileged few.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: Like other crises in the past, the coronavirus pandemic has provided an opportunity for communities to act on their most exclusionary impulses. This summer, private pools and beach clubs, as well as public facilities in wealthier areas, are reopening with new measures to ensure that the general public stays out: hiring more security, aggressively checking beach tags and restricting access to residents only.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Who Will Get to Swim This Summer?

2020-06-28.abstract: The state wanted to be among the first to reopen. It’s now dealing with the consequences.
2020-06-28.snippet: The state wanted to be among the first to reopen. It’s now dealing with the consequences.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — For one brief, delusional moment in early April, I felt a smidgen of support for my governor, Greg Abbott. Sure, part of me thought his plan to reopen the state after just a few weeks of lockdown was cuckoo. Medical experts warned of a surge in coronavirus cases if Texas did just that.
2020-06-28.headline_main: How Texas Swaggered Into a Coronavirus Disaster

2020-06-28.abstract: As disease and war ravaged the nation, he left town and invented the essay.
2020-06-28.snippet: As disease and war ravaged the nation, he left town and invented the essay.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: In the summer of 1585, the mayor of Bordeaux learned, from the comfort of his nearby chateau, that the bubonic plague had burst upon his city. Those who could were fleeing, he was told, while those who could not were “dying like flies.” What to do? His term in office, on the one hand, was nearly over and his last official duty was to attend the transition ceremony. On the other hand, perhaps his duty was with those still inside the city walls.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Montaigne Fled the Plague, and Found Himself

2020-06-28.abstract: An Argentine man stuck in Portugal because of the virus travels for 85 days the only way he could: in a small boat.
2020-06-28.snippet: An Argentine man stuck in Portugal because of the virus travels for 85 days the only way he could: in a small boat.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — Days after Argentina canceled all international passenger flights to shield the country from the new coronavirus, Juan Manuel Ballestero began his journey home the only way possible: He stepped aboard his small sailboat for what turned out to be an 85-day odyssey across the Atlantic.
2020-06-28.headline_main: With Flights Banned, Son Sails Solo Across Atlantic to Reach Father, 90

2020-06-28.snippet: Allan Adam leads a Dene nation that famously fought the Canadian government and oil lobby in its territory.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — He survived Canada’s notoriously abusive schools for Indigenous children and went on to lead his own nation. He battled governments and oil giants over the pollution of his traditional territory, garnering him the praise and admiration of Desmond Tutu, Greta Thunberg and celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio.

2020-06-28.abstract: The New York police have taken on a vast purview beyond crime fighting that includes schools and mental health. Officials are now rethinking that.
2020-06-28.snippet: The New York police have taken on a vast purview beyond crime fighting that includes schools and mental health. Officials are now rethinking that.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: When someone in the grip of a mental health emergency behaves erratically in New York City, it is the Police Department that is often called in. When there are serious disciplinary problems in the schools, or when homeless people are found sleeping in the subways, police officers are asked to take over.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Why the $6 Billion N.Y.P.D. Is Now a Target of ‘Defund the Police’

The flights, which could begin as soon as Monday, represent a major step in the company’s effort to get its best-selling plane flying again.

2020-06-28.headline_main: Museum of the City of New York: Reduced but Reopening

2020-06-28.abstract: In Duncan Macmillan’s play, streaming live from the Old Vic, the stars of “The Crown” play a contradictory couple in an age of isolation.
2020-06-28.snippet: In Duncan Macmillan’s play, streaming live from the Old Vic, the stars of “The Crown” play a contradictory couple in an age of isolation.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: The woman and man who make up the entire cast of Duncan Macmillan’s “Lungs,” which is streaming in a beautifully acted (and socially distanced) live production from London’s Old Vic Theater, are people who seldom think before they talk. Feelings — big, sloppy, mixed, unedited, self-incriminating feelings — slosh out of them like the contents of overfilled, foaming beer mugs on a wobbly tray.
2020-06-28.headline_main: ‘Lungs’ Review: Claire Foy and Matt Smith Chase Love in the Dark

2020-06-28.snippet: The recovery of large amounts of American cash at a Taliban outpost in Afghanistan helped tip off U.S. officials. It is believed that at least one U.S. troop death was the result of the bounties.
2020-06-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — United States intelligence officers and Special Operations forces in Afghanistan alerted their superiors as early as January to a suspected Russian plot to pay bounties to the Taliban to kill American troops in Afghanistan, according to officials briefed on the matter. They believed at least one U.S. troop death was the result of the bounties, two of the officials said.
2020-06-28.headline_main: Spies and Commandos Warned Months Ago of Russian Bounties on U.S. Troops

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: The flashbacks occur at intervals throughout the episode. They take us to the trenches of World War I — still without its even more savage sequel by the time “Perry Mason” takes place — where our title character is an American military officer, leading his men in a charge over the top. In the chaos of the no man’s land, the charge breaks down. Those who’ve survived German machine guns and flame throwers now must contend with a huge wave of enemy troops mounting a counterattack … and the lethal poison gas clearing their way.
2020-06-29.headline_main: ‘Perry Mason’ Season 1, Episode 2: In the Trenches

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: OCEAN’S TWELVE (2004) 7:15 p.m. on AMC. This summer’s slate of popcorn movies has been drastically reduced by the pandemic but Steven Soderbergh’s sequel to “Oceans Eleven” could provide some of what moviegoers may be missing. In her review for The New York Times, Manohla Dargis called this crime comedy an “enjoyable, unabashedly trivial caper flick.” George Clooney returns as Danny Ocean, the leader of a gang that specializes in baroque heists. This time, his team is scheming to pay off the casino owner they robbed in the first film. To come up with the money, the crew relocates to Europe, where they quickly find themselves in competition with a master thief.
2020-06-29.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘And She Could Be Next’ and ‘The Sommerdahl Murders’

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Pretty quickly, Paolo Dal Pino realized that the illustrious list of names on his glittering résumé, the long years spent in the boardrooms of some of Italy’s corporate behemoths, the experience that had gotten him the job — none of it was fitting preparation for running his country’s top soccer league.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Italian Soccer’s Fractious Chorus Tries a New Tune: Cooperation

2020-06-29.abstract: An appellate court will decide whether video evidence is admissible in the case against the New England Patriots owner. It was thrown out by a court in Palm Beach County, Fla., in May 2019.
2020-06-29.snippet: An appellate court will decide whether video evidence is admissible in the case against the New England Patriots owner. It was thrown out by a court in Palm Beach County, Fla., in May 2019.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: A three-judge panel in the Florida Fourth District Court of Appeal in West Palm Beach will hear an appeal of the case against the New England Patriots’ owner, Robert K. Kraft, this week when it considers a lower court’s decision to throw out video evidence that is central to the two misdemeanor charges against him for solicitation of prostitution. The case will be argued via videoconference beginning on June 30 and livestreamed on the court’s website because of coronavirus concerns.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Florida Court Will Hear Video Appeal in Robert Kraft Case

2020-06-29.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic is exposing a central flaw in America’s health care system.
2020-06-29.snippet: The coronavirus pandemic is exposing a central flaw in America’s health care system.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: In the early months of 2020, Americans were engaged in the perennial election-year debate over how best to reform the nation’s health care system. As usual, the electorate was torn and confused. Polling indicated that a small majority of likely voters favored a new universal system that would cover everyone. But that support evaporated when it was made clear that any such overhaul would involve abolishing the private insurance market. At the time, nearly 160 million Americans received their health benefits through an employer, and the vast majority of them liked that coverage just fine — maybe not enough to sing about it, but enough to be wary of a potential replacement.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Employer-Based Health Care, Meet Massive Unemployment

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — On May 18, a 14-year-old boy was playing pool with his cousin and other teenagers in a backyard in São Gonçalo, in the metropolitan region of Rio de Janeiro. Police officers, in pursuit of a drug dealer, fired over 70 shots into the home, killing him. He was black. His name was João Pedro Matos Pinto. There have been so many others.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Latin America Is Ready for Its Black Lives Matter Reckoning

The relationship with her longtime partner quickly crumbled under the pressure. They broke up “due to mental health issues” that she said started to appear with both of them being stressed out and inside all day.

2020-06-29.abstract: There is still time, and it can be done safely. The economic and social payoff is totally worth it.
2020-06-29.snippet: There is still time, and it can be done safely. The economic and social payoff is totally worth it.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: As our country grapples with both a pandemic and the devastating impacts of long-term systemic racism, political leaders are rightfully looking to enact policies that meaningfully benefit low-income and minority communities. Many solutions will take time, but there is one action that mayors across the country — including in New York City — can take right now to support the communities hurting the most: Restore summer jobs programs for young people.

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: This year’s plague, the newly emerged coronavirus, will likely spare many people from being attacked by an ancient scourge: bedbugs. Given the drastic pandemic-induced reductions in travel and nights spent in hotels, motels and other venues outside one’s home, the chances of being bitten by or bringing home these uninvited guests have been greatly curtailed.
2020-06-29.headline_main: The Pandemic May Spare Us From Another Plague: Bedbugs

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: “Unsettled: Seeking Refuge in America” begins as a typical issue documentary, with the goal of raising awareness of refugees who have been persecuted for being L.G.B.T.Q. It follows four people who have come to the United States: Subhi from Syria, Junior from the Democratic Republic of Congo and the couple Mari and Cheyenne from Angola. They have stories of vicious discrimination and estrangement from family members. When they arrive in the San Francisco area, volunteers help them acclimate, but finding work and housing make settling difficult.
2020-06-29.headline_main: ‘Unsettled: Seeking Refuge in America’ Review: Embracing a New Home

2020-06-29.abstract: Mr. Fillon was sentenced to prison time. His 2017 presidential bid fell apart after allegations that he paid his wife with taxpayer funds for a fake job.
2020-06-29.snippet: Mr. Fillon was sentenced to prison time. His 2017 presidential bid fell apart after allegations that he paid his wife with taxpayer funds for a fake job.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: PARIS — François Fillon, a former French prime minister, was found guilty on Monday of embezzling public funds and sentenced to prison time in a scandal involving a no-show job for his wife that crippled his front-runner status in the 2017 presidential race and led to a broader resentment of France’s political elite.
2020-06-29.headline_main: François Fillon, Ex-Presidential Hopeful in France, Is Convicted of Embezzlement

2020-06-29.abstract: An exhibition at the palace that hosted the Potsdam Conference at the end of World War II examines the event’s far-reaching impact.
2020-06-29.snippet: An exhibition at the palace that hosted the Potsdam Conference at the end of World War II examines the event’s far-reaching impact.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: POTSDAM, Germany — Winston Churchill’s walking cane, Panama hat and cigar tube are on their way here, but they’ve been delayed.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Looking Back on 16 Days That Shaped History

2020-06-29.abstract: The red carpet didn’t exactly return. But fashion did.
2020-06-29.snippet: The red carpet didn’t exactly return. But fashion did.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: It wasn’t your usual awards show red carpet. There wasn’t, after all, a red carpet. Instead there were nominees and performers and presenters beamed in from their living rooms or movie-magicked sets.
2020-06-29.headline_main: At the BET Awards, Putting Black Designers in the Spotlight

2020-06-29.abstract: Monday: Whales are dying at alarming rates, but the pandemic is keeping researchers away. Also: Gov. Gavin Newsom closes bars in some counties.
2020-06-29.snippet: Monday: Whales are dying at alarming rates, but the pandemic is keeping researchers away. Also: Gov. Gavin Newsom closes bars in some counties.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2020-06-29.headline_main: How the Pandemic Is Making It Tougher to Study Whales

2020-06-29.abstract: A French Normandy-style house in Pasadena, a contemporary farmhouse-style home in El Segundo and a converted 1910 municipal building in Port Costa.
2020-06-29.snippet: A French Normandy-style house in Pasadena, a contemporary farmhouse-style home in El Segundo and a converted 1910 municipal building in Port Costa.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: A French Normandy-style house in Pasadena, a contemporary farmhouse-style home in El Segundo and a converted 1910 municipal building in Port Costa.
2020-06-29.headline_main: What You Get for $2.6 Million in California

2020-06-29.abstract: A French Normandy-style house in Pasadena, a contemporary farmhouse-style home in El Segundo and a converted 1910 municipal building in Port Costa.
2020-06-29.snippet: A French Normandy-style house in Pasadena, a contemporary farmhouse-style home in El Segundo and a converted 1910 municipal building in Port Costa.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: This house, attributed to Sylvanus Marston, was built in 1927 in the French Normandy style and has had relatively few alterations over its life span. Mr. Marston’s architecture firm, Marston, Van Pelt & Maybury, worked regularly in Pasadena and was responsible for a number of structures in the area, including the former Vista del Arroyo Hotel, now a U.S. Court of Appeals building, the auditorium of Pasadena City College and the USC Pacific Asia Museum.
2020-06-29.headline_main: $2.6 Million Homes in California

2020-06-29.abstract: When kids are in quarantine, how are infections possible?
2020-06-29.snippet: When kids are in quarantine, how are infections possible?
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: A livid rash appeared on my 3-year-old’s face two weeks ago. At first I thought it was just the work of one very aggressive mosquito, but after a couple of days the red marks deepened. My first question was: What is this gross rash? My second: How is my child still getting weird and possibly communicable diseases when she has not touched another child besides her sister since March?
2020-06-29.headline_main: The Rash Is Coming From Inside the House

2020-06-29.abstract: Beyoncé received a humanitarian award, and performances made explicit references to protests against racism and police brutality at the first major awards show of the Covid-19 era.
2020-06-29.snippet: Beyoncé received a humanitarian award, and performances made explicit references to protests against racism and police brutality at the first major awards show of the Covid-19 era.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Political performances by Public Enemy, DaBaby, Alicia Keys and John Legend, civic-minded speeches by Michelle Obama and Beyoncé, and a series of tributes to George Floyd and Breonna Taylor led a virtual, mostly socially distanced and social justice-themed version of the BET Awards on Sunday, the first major awards show of the pandemic era.
2020-06-29.headline_main: BET Awards Put Black Lives at Center of Socially Distant Show

2020-06-29.abstract: Nannies are often told they’re like members of the families they work for, but during a pandemic, they can be let go rather quickly.
2020-06-29.snippet: Nannies are often told they’re like members of the families they work for, but during a pandemic, they can be let go rather quickly.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: In late February, Jennifer, a nanny in her mid-40s, began dreading her commute.
2020-06-29.headline_main: For Nannies, Both a Job and a Family Can Abruptly Disappear

2020-06-29.abstract: A Tehran prosecutor said that Iran had asked for international help in detaining people involved in the drone strike that killed the powerful general.
2020-06-29.snippet: A Tehran prosecutor said that Iran had asked for international help in detaining people involved in the drone strike that killed the powerful general.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Iran has issued an arrest warrant for President Trump and 35 other people it says were involved in a drone strike that killed a top Iranian general in Baghdad this year and has asked for international help in detaining them, according to Iranian news reports.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Iran Issues Arrest Warrants for Trump and 35 Others in Suleimani Killing

2020-06-29.abstract: New York City has begun the slow process of reopening, but that doesn’t mean a return to normal. The next phase will look quite different from the city we knew before the shutdown.
2020-06-29.snippet: New York City has begun the slow process of reopening, but that doesn’t mean a return to normal. The next phase will look quite different from the city we knew before the shutdown.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Q: Even though New York is now in Phase 2 of its reopening process, the board of my Manhattan co-op is still following strict rules about vendors and visitors. All guests have to fill out a form providing their name and address, and answer personal questions about the reason for their visit, the state of their health, and even the mode of transport they used. Housekeepers, dog walkers and nannies still can’t come in at all. Is the board allowed to be this invasive and restrictive?
2020-06-29.headline_main: Can Dog Walkers and Nannies Come Into My Co-op Now?

2020-06-29.abstract: The move clears the way for the executions of four men in the coming months after a 17-year gap during which no inmate on death row for federal crimes was put to death.
2020-06-29.snippet: The move clears the way for the executions of four men in the coming months after a 17-year gap during which no inmate on death row for federal crimes was put to death.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday let stand an appeals court ruling allowing the Trump administration to resume executions in federal death penalty cases after a 17-year hiatus. The court’s order cleared the way for the executions of four men in the coming months.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Federal Executions Can Restart After Supreme Court Declines a Case

2020-06-29.abstract: The case, over a state law requiring doctors performing abortions to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals, is the first abortion ruling since two Trump appointees joined the court.
2020-06-29.snippet: The case, over a state law requiring doctors performing abortions to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals, is the first abortion ruling since two Trump appointees joined the court.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday struck down a Louisiana law that could have left the state with a single abortion clinic, dashing the hopes of conservatives who were counting on President Trump’s appointments to lead the court to sustain restrictions on abortion rights and, eventually, to overrule Roe v. Wade.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Supreme Court Strikes Down Louisiana Abortion Law, With Roberts the Deciding Vote

2020-06-29.abstract: The six-episode show will be based on the athlete’s teenage years growing up Black with a white adoptive family.
2020-06-29.snippet: The six-episode show will be based on the athlete’s teenage years growing up Black with a white adoptive family.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Colin Kaepernick has yet to be invited back to the National Football League, but Netflix is welcoming him with open arms. The former quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers who sparked a movement when he knelt during the national anthem to protest police brutality and racial inequality has joined forces with the writer-director Ava DuVernay for a six-episode Netflix series. The show, “Colin in Black & White,” will center on the athlete’s teenage years.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Netflix Series About Colin Kaepernick Is in the Works From Ava DuVernay

2020-06-29.abstract: It’s an example of the unpredictable way health prices can vary for patients who receive identical care.
2020-06-29.snippet: It’s an example of the unpredictable way health prices can vary for patients who receive identical care.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Before a camping and kayaking trip along the Texas Coast, Pam LeBlanc and Jimmy Harvey decided to get coronavirus tests. They wanted a bit more peace of mind before spending 13 days in close quarters along with three friends.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Two Friends in Texas Were Tested for Coronavirus. One Bill Was $199. The Other? $6,408.

2020-06-29.abstract: The case concerning the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was part of a politically charged battle over presidential authority.
2020-06-29.snippet: The case concerning the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau was part of a politically charged battle over presidential authority.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court ruled on Monday that the president is free to fire the director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau without cause. The decision, rejecting a federal law that sought to place limits on presidential oversight of independent agencies, was a victory for the conservative movement to curb the administrative state.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Supreme Court Lifts Limits on Trump’s Power to Fire Consumer Watchdog

2020-06-29.abstract: Yewande Komolafe has a new tofu recipe, for a crisp take with cashews and blistered snap peas.
2020-06-29.snippet: Yewande Komolafe has a new tofu recipe, for a crisp take with cashews and blistered snap peas.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Good morning. My friend Kirsch was on the phone, saying how it’s gotten to the point where all she wants to do is make a big batch of a condiment and use it all the time. Anchovy compound butter, for instance, to spread on toast in the morning and eat with eggs; then to foam at night as a bath for asparagus; to dab on potatoes; to eat again on toast in the morning, again with eggs.
2020-06-29.headline_main: New Tofu Recipe!

2020-06-29.abstract: The Minneapolis police chief recently described George Floyd’s death as murder. Lawyers for the four officers charged in the case say that may have biased potential jurors.
2020-06-29.snippet: The Minneapolis police chief recently described George Floyd’s death as murder. Lawyers for the four officers charged in the case say that may have biased potential jurors.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — The judge overseeing the case against four former Minneapolis police officers in the death of George Floyd told lawyers and local officials on Monday to be careful about what they say, warning that too much publicity could make it difficult to choose an impartial jury.
2020-06-29.headline_main: In Court, Derek Chauvin’s Lawyers Say Officials Have Biased the Case

2020-06-29.abstract: In response to the pandemic as well as a desire for more racial and socioeconomic diversity, the Utah event will simultaneously take place in cinemas around North America.
2020-06-29.snippet: In response to the pandemic as well as a desire for more racial and socioeconomic diversity, the Utah event will simultaneously take place in cinemas around North America.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Sundance is coming down from the mountain.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Sundance 2021 Will Be Held in at Least 20 Cities

2020-06-29.abstract: Bringing millions of students back to campus would create enormous risks for society but comparatively little educational benefit, an economist says.
2020-06-29.snippet: Bringing millions of students back to campus would create enormous risks for society but comparatively little educational benefit, an economist says.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Each fall, millions of students head to college campuses. Most stay close to home, but many crisscross the country to study in a different state.
2020-06-29.headline_main: College Is Worth It, but Campus Isn’t

2020-06-29.abstract: Surface air temperatures at the bottom of the world have risen three times faster than the global average since the 1990s.
2020-06-29.snippet: Surface air temperatures at the bottom of the world have risen three times faster than the global average since the 1990s.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: The South Pole, the most isolated part of the planet, is also one of the most rapidly warming ones, scientists said Monday, with surface air temperatures rising since the 1990s at a rate that is three times faster than the global average.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Even the South Pole Is Warming, and Quickly, Scientists Say

2020-06-29.abstract: The industry said it would refund tickets through Jan. 3, and hopes that shows would be able to reopen “over a series of rolling dates in early 2021.”
2020-06-29.snippet: The industry said it would refund tickets through Jan. 3, and hopes that shows would be able to reopen “over a series of rolling dates in early 2021.”
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Broadway will remain closed for at least the rest of this year, and many shows are signaling that they do not expect a return to the stage until late winter or early spring.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Broadway Will Remain Closed Through the Rest of the Year

2020-06-29.abstract: Working at home can offer great benefits, but without attention being paid to one’s workstation, it can also mean aches and pains. Here are seven steps to achieving a more ergonomic setup.
2020-06-29.snippet: Working at home can offer great benefits, but without attention being paid to one’s workstation, it can also mean aches and pains. Here are seven steps to achieving a more ergonomic setup.

2020-06-29.abstract: A look at one of the entries from last week’s puzzles that stumped our solvers.
2020-06-29.snippet: A look at one of the entries from last week’s puzzles that stumped our solvers.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: As if by magic, the word MAGE erased itself from solvers’ heads in the Saturday, June 27, puzzle by Ryan McCarty. It was the most “revealed” entry among online and app solvers in last week’s crosswords.
2020-06-29.headline_main: What the Heck Is That?

2020-06-29.abstract: It’s an old story, of being ignored, patronized or dismissed. But for Black retailers, sommeliers, writers and winemakers, the days of invisibility are over.
2020-06-29.snippet: It’s an old story, of being ignored, patronized or dismissed. But for Black retailers, sommeliers, writers and winemakers, the days of invisibility are over.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: TJ Douglas and his wife, Hadley, own Urban Grape, a thriving wine shop in the South End neighborhood of Boston. Before the pandemic, a regular internet customer with whom Mr. Douglas had had many discussions online about wine, walked into the shop for the first time.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Black Wine Professionals Demand to Be Seen

2020-06-29.abstract: The baritone Liu Keqing has spent his career delighting fans in opera houses and on social media, but lately his likeness has attracted the Chinese authorities’ attention.
2020-06-29.snippet: The baritone Liu Keqing has spent his career delighting fans in opera houses and on social media, but lately his likeness has attracted the Chinese authorities’ attention.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: The long stares and startled whispers — Is that him? — begin as soon as Liu Keqing, an imposing Chinese baritone, enters any room in China. With a square face, closely cropped black hair and a portly figure, Mr. Liu bears a striking resemblance to Xi Jinping, China’s top leader.
2020-06-29.headline_main: A Singing Xi Jinping Look-Alike Battles the Censors in China

2020-06-29.abstract: The outbreak is raging outside Moscow, but President Vladimir V. Putin is committed to a national vote that could keep him in power for another 16 years.
2020-06-29.snippet: The outbreak is raging outside Moscow, but President Vladimir V. Putin is committed to a national vote that could keep him in power for another 16 years.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Despairing of finding enough beds for patients stricken with the coronavirus, a nurse in the Siberian city of Irkutsk has been forced to begin taking people to a village hospital more than 100 miles away.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Putin Pushes Through Referendum Even as Virus Surges in Russia

2020-06-29.abstract: City officials have vowed to dismantle the free-protest area set up during anti-police demonstrations and retake the Capitol Hill police station. But worries of confrontation have delayed a resolution.
2020-06-29.snippet: City officials have vowed to dismantle the free-protest area set up during anti-police demonstrations and retake the Capitol Hill police station. But worries of confrontation have delayed a resolution.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Two teenagers have been shot, one fatally, in the fourth shooting in 10 days within the boundaries of the free-protest zone set up near downtown Seattle amid a national wave of protests over police violence.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Another Fatal Shooting in Seattle’s ‘CHOP’ Protest Zone

2020-06-29.abstract: Young women feeling alienated by dating apps and bar culture are finding love on their For You pages.
2020-06-29.snippet: Young women feeling alienated by dating apps and bar culture are finding love on their For You pages.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: On Feb. 3, Lauren Vlach received $8 on Venmo, spread across four $2 payments, from a girl she had never met. Each payment included a block of text; read together, they formed what Cas Stephens, who sent the payments, titled her “girlfriend application” to Ms. Vlach.
2020-06-29.headline_main: For Lesbians, TikTok Is ‘the Next Tinder’

2020-06-29.abstract: “Thousands of people are still dying in Brazil, and we’re forced to play football with no protection,” Mario Bittencourt, the chairman of a Brazilian soccer team, wrote before a game.
2020-06-29.snippet: “Thousands of people are still dying in Brazil, and we’re forced to play football with no protection,” Mario Bittencourt, the chairman of a Brazilian soccer team, wrote before a game.

2020-06-29.headline_main: Athletes Speak Out Against Returning: ‘People Are Still Dying’

2020-06-29.abstract: Marches, vigils and rallies have settled in as a part of the city’s daily life, one already disrupted by the pandemic.
2020-06-29.snippet: Marches, vigils and rallies have settled in as a part of the city’s daily life, one already disrupted by the pandemic.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of New Yorkers have poured onto city streets for the last month. They have marched hundreds of miles, closed bridges, shut down highways and, most recently, taken up residence outside City Hall, calling for the police budget to be slashed.
2020-06-29.headline_main: ‘There’s Going to Be More Demands’: What’s Next for N.Y. Protests

2020-06-29.abstract: The string of rapes and murders stretched back to the 1970s. On Monday, in a converted ballroom in Sacramento, the former police officer admitted his guilt.
2020-06-29.snippet: The string of rapes and murders stretched back to the 1970s. On Monday, in a converted ballroom in Sacramento, the former police officer admitted his guilt.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: For decades, a killer was on the loose in California, terrorizing victims from the southern coast to the Central Valley to the Bay Area and the tidy subdivisions near Sacramento. As the years went by, he bore his way into the state’s consciousness, provoking manhunts and television shows, and the obsessive sleuthing of amateur detectives.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Joseph DeAngelo Pleads Guilty in Golden State Killer Cases

2020-06-29.abstract: Primary care physicians, to whom many anxious patients turn first when their health declines, can’t always provide tests — or answers about where to get them.
2020-06-29.snippet: Primary care physicians, to whom many anxious patients turn first when their health declines, can’t always provide tests — or answers about where to get them.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: In recent months, Dr. Denise Hooks-Anderson has grown accustomed to saying “no.”
2020-06-29.headline_main: Does Your Local Doctor Have a Coronavirus Test for You?

2020-06-29.snippet: States are rushing to reopen and parents are left to decide for themselves what is safe.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Lately, Sophia Gholz has started to feel like her family is the odd one out.
2020-06-29.headline_main: As Coronavirus Cases Surge, Families Struggle to Draw Boundaries

2020-06-29.snippet: Young people have tweaked the conspiracy, and today’s internet sites help spread such false ideas.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.
2020-06-29.headline_main: A TikTok Twist on ‘PizzaGate’

2020-06-29.abstract: The movement has a long pipeline of new cases that, if taken up by the Supreme Court, could present a more direct challenge to Roe v. Wade.
2020-06-29.snippet: The movement has a long pipeline of new cases that, if taken up by the Supreme Court, could present a more direct challenge to Roe v. Wade.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: For anti-abortion activists, Monday’s Supreme Court ruling against a Louisiana law delivered a stinging and surprising setback. But perhaps not for long.
2020-06-29.headline_main: The Supreme Court Stopped Anti-Abortion Momentum. For Now.

2020-06-29.abstract: The Nobel Prize-winning musician is the first artist to reach the Billboard Top 40 with a new album in each decade from the 1960s to the 2020s.
2020-06-29.snippet: The Nobel Prize-winning musician is the first artist to reach the Billboard Top 40 with a new album in each decade from the 1960s to the 2020s.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Most weeks, the top of the Billboard album chart is a story of hip-hop, more hip-hop and maybe a pop star. This week it also features Bob Dylan, the 79-year-old songwriter and cultural chameleon who four years ago won the Nobel Prize in Literature.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Bob Dylan Makes Chart History With ‘Rough and Rowdy Ways’

2020-06-29.abstract: The investigation into Russia’s suspected operation is said to focus in part on the killings of three Marines in a truck bombing last year, officials said.
2020-06-29.snippet: The investigation into Russia’s suspected operation is said to focus in part on the killings of three Marines in a truck bombing last year, officials said.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: American officials provided a written briefing in late February to President Trump laying out their conclusion that a Russian military intelligence unit offered and paid bounties to Taliban-linked militants to kill U.S. and coalition troops in Afghanistan, two officials familiar with the matter said.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Trump Got Written Briefing in February on Possible Russian Bounties, Officials Say

2020-06-29.abstract: The influential pro-Trump community broke the rules on harassment and targeting, said Reddit, which also banned other groups.
2020-06-29.snippet: The influential pro-Trump community broke the rules on harassment and targeting, said Reddit, which also banned other groups.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Reddit, one of the largest social networking and message board websites, on Monday banned its biggest community devoted to President Trump as part of an overhaul of its hate speech policies.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Reddit, Acting Against Hate Speech, Bans ‘The_Donald’ Subreddit

2020-06-29.abstract: The effort began with one reporter’s spreadsheet, and expanded with contributions from dozens of people with varying skill sets across the newsroom.
2020-06-29.snippet: The effort began with one reporter’s spreadsheet, and expanded with contributions from dozens of people with varying skill sets across the newsroom.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.
2020-06-29.headline_main: How The Times Is Counting Every Coronavirus Case in the Country

2020-06-29.abstract: When a planarian loses its eyes, cellular guides connect new ones to its brain so it can see again.
2020-06-29.snippet: When a planarian loses its eyes, cellular guides connect new ones to its brain so it can see again.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Planarians have unusual talents, to say the least. If you slice one of the tiny flatworms in half, the halves will grow back, giving you two identical worms. Cut a flatworm’s head in two, and it will grow two heads. Cut an eye off a flatworm — it will grow back. Stick an eye on a flatworm that lacks eyes — it’ll take root. Pieces as small as one-279th of a flatworm will turn into new, whole flatworms, given the time.
2020-06-29.headline_main: A Worm’s Hidden Map for Growing New Eyes

2020-06-29.abstract: A conversation with the graphic designer, who, until his death at 91, was still thinking about how his craft could help his beleaguered city.
2020-06-29.snippet: A conversation with the graphic designer, who, until his death at 91, was still thinking about how his craft could help his beleaguered city.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Five weeks ago, I received a call from Milton Glaser. We’d never met, but he was kindly answering an email I’d sent his studio a few hours prior. At best, I expected a response from his assistant. Instead, I got a FaceTime Audio call from the 90-year-old graphic designer. The result was a conversation that ranged from the confounding nature of his success to the motivation for his latest project. It would be one of his last interviews before his death on Friday, his 91st birthday.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Milton Glaser’s Unseen Design for New York: ‘Together’

2020-06-29.abstract: With their showrooms closed this spring, instrument dealers around the country report surprise at the robust numbers.
2020-06-29.snippet: With their showrooms closed this spring, instrument dealers around the country report surprise at the robust numbers.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: When the coronavirus sequestered Americans at home and forced businesses to close, Hale Ryan braced himself for a financial winter. As the director of sales and marketing at Metroplex Piano in Dallas and a 30-year veteran of the piano business, he had seen other crises — like 9/11 and the 2008 recession — damage sales. When the lockdown began in March, Mr. Ryan said in a recent phone interview, “I thought this was going to be the final nail.”
2020-06-29.headline_main: Concerts Disappeared. Piano Sales Survived.

2020-06-29.abstract: The move is part of the tit-for-tat retaliation after the Indian and Chinese militaries clashed earlier this month.
2020-06-29.snippet: The move is part of the tit-for-tat retaliation after the Indian and Chinese militaries clashed earlier this month.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: India’s government banned nearly 60 Chinese mobile apps on Monday, including TikTok, citing national security concerns, after a deadly clash between their militaries this month raised tensions between the two countries to the highest level in decades.
2020-06-29.headline_main: India Bans Nearly 60 Chinese Apps, Including TikTok and WeChat

Mr. Okeke-Agulu believes the items were looted in the late 1960s during the country’s brutal civil war.

2020-06-29.snippet: Stefano Massini’s “The Lehman Trilogy,” a novel in verse related to his play of the same name, covers 160 years in the life of the Lehmans and their business.

Arthur Miller’s “Death of a Salesman,” published by Viking Press, was a Book-of-the-Month Club selection; Edward Albee’s “Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf?” made good money in hardcover and paperback for Atheneum.

2020-06-29.abstract: Pride Month may have come to a close, but the wide-ranging pieces shown here have staying power.
2020-06-29.snippet: Pride Month may have come to a close, but the wide-ranging pieces shown here have staying power.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: As the country contends with ongoing violence against queer and BIPOC communities, it’s paramount that voices from those communities are heard. Not all artists are activists, of course, but they are all keen observers, ones who invite the viewer to consider their way of seeing things, whether their chosen subject is as expansive as prison reform or as singular as their own sense of self. Each work tells a story, and here, we’ve asked 15 queer artists of color to elaborate on theirs. (Look for a coming compilation of works by queer Indigenous artists in the weeks ahead.)

2020-06-29.snippet: She was the first female officer of the Federal Reserve Bank. Later, in another first, she ran a commercial bank largely owned and operated by women.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: In the 1940s and ’50s, when Madeline McWhinney was a young economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, banking was such a men’s club that meetings were often held inside one. At such gatherings at the Union League Club on Park Avenue, which didn’t allow women to join until the late 1980s, Ms. McWhinney had to enter through a side door and be chaperoned by an older Fed official.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Madeline McWhinney Dale, Trailblazing Banker, Is Dead at 98

2020-06-29.abstract: Marky’s, a caviar dealer, now sells beluga raised in at an aquafarm in Florida.
2020-06-29.snippet: Marky’s, a caviar dealer, now sells beluga raised in at an aquafarm in Florida.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: This is not the best moment to discuss caviar, what with the pandemic and the subsequent fiscal stress. But there is some news worth noting: For the first time, beluga caviar, the roe of the largest variety of sturgeon, native to the Caspian Sea, has been successfully farm-raised in the United States. After 17 years of trying, Marky’s, a caviar producer, importer and dealer in Florida, has a crop of beluga from its Sturgeon Aquafarms in northern Florida. The importation, distribution and sale of purebred huso huso, or beluga, in the United States have been banned by the Fish & Wildlife Service since 2005, but this Marky’s caviar has been granted an exception to the ruling. So now, if you have $420 to splurge on a half-ounce, you can indulge in the delicate, buttery, nicely textured, though modest-grained, charcoal gray roe. And if a holiday in summer might not whet the appetite for jewel-box caviar, Marky’s also offers a celebratory package of American roes containing two ounces each of hackleback, paddlefish and salmon roes with blini and crème fraîche for $115 to enjoy on the Fourth.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Beluga, Farm-Raised in America

2020-06-29.abstract: Zimmerman, a pillar of the Nationals’ World Series-winning team, will skip the season, citing personal and family safety. Desmond of the Rockies, Joe Ross of the Nationals and Mike Leake of the Diamondbacks also opted out.
2020-06-29.snippet: Zimmerman, a pillar of the Nationals’ World Series-winning team, will skip the season, citing personal and family safety. Desmond of the Rockies, Joe Ross of the Nationals and Mike Leake of the Diamondbacks also opted out.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: The stories of the Washington Nationals and Ryan Zimmerman are intertwined. The franchise moved from Montreal, where they were known as the Expos, in 2005, the same year they drafted Zimmerman out of college. He reached the major leagues late that season and has been with them ever since, the face of the franchise through the lean seasons, their renaissance and, last year, their first World Series title.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Ryan Zimmerman, Ian Desmond and 2 Others Opt Out of M.L.B. Season

2020-06-29.abstract: The Trump administration’s new restrictions come in response to a new national security law that extends China’s influence over Hong Kong.

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration placed new restrictions on U.S. exports of defense equipment and certain high-technology products to Hong Kong on Monday, in response to a new Chinese law aimed at tightening Beijing’s control over the territory.

2020-06-29.abstract: The Cam Newton signing shows why league observers have nearly unshakable faith in decisions made by the New England Patriots’ coach. “People are just so used to Bill Belichick figuring it out.”
2020-06-29.snippet: The Cam Newton signing shows why league observers have nearly unshakable faith in decisions made by the New England Patriots’ coach. “People are just so used to Bill Belichick figuring it out.”
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: When Derek Jeter retired after the 2014 season, the Yankees did not have an obvious internal candidate to replace him, and that was not a problem. They believed, and so did their fans, that the team’s next shortstop, no matter what, would be a good one, and he was: Didi Gregorius, acquired in a trade, blossomed into a dynamic all-around player during five seasons in pinstripes after an inauspicious start.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Bill Belichick Never Tipped His Post-Brady Plan. Now It’s Clear.

2020-06-29.abstract: Quarantine Vodka, a new spirit from San Diego, is meant for the home bar and is named for pandemic life.
2020-06-29.snippet: Quarantine Vodka, a new spirit from San Diego, is meant for the home bar and is named for pandemic life.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Intended for making cocktails at home, and with a name that one hopes might become a memory some day, the new Quarantine Vodka from San Diego is quite distinctive. The vodka, made from corn, is distilled six times without erasing its assertive finish — you know there’s booze in your drink. It’s also straightforward and clean-tasting, with slight viscosity.
2020-06-29.headline_main: A Vodka for Our Time

2020-06-29.abstract: The Kit for a Cause from Hudson Valley Fisheries benefits Relief Opportunities for All Restaurants.
2020-06-29.snippet: The Kit for a Cause from Hudson Valley Fisheries benefits Relief Opportunities for All Restaurants.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: In Hudson, N.Y., steelhead trout, a delicious salmon wannabe, are thriving. And Hudson Valley Fisheries, which is raising the fish indoors, is offering a package of two one-pound fillets (with pin-bones removed), two cedar planks and four ounces of its alluring cold-smoked steelhead for $50, with $12.50 of the price going toward Relief Opportunities for All Restaurants a.k.a. ROAR NY. You get enough fresh fish to feed six. Consider the steelhead for your Fourth of July menu. Back in the day in New England, salmon and peas were traditional for the holiday, and you’d be fine with steelhead.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Steelhead Trout for a Good Cause

2020-06-29.abstract: Milène Jardine sells gift boxes for those on the front line of the pandemic.
2020-06-29.snippet: Milène Jardine sells gift boxes for those on the front line of the pandemic.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Milène Jardine, a New York chocolatier, has added something new to its online store: the option to buy a box of chocolates ($38.50) for a health care worker. Send them to a worker the chocolatier chooses or to someone you know. To treat yourself, friends or family, there are other delights. A collection of square truffles, with creamy ganache fillings inspired by different destinations, comes in boxes of five or 15. Truffles influenced by India and Japan give you a subtle taste of ginger, turmeric and black pepper. From Egypt, there’s hibiscus and mint. Chocolate bars, also drawing international inspiration, are available.
2020-06-29.headline_main: Chocolates for Health Care Workers

2020-06-29.abstract: Californians are asking themselves, what went wrong?
2020-06-29.snippet: Californians are asking themselves, what went wrong?
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Early in the outbreak, California emerged as a leader in fighting the spread of the coronavirus. It was the first state to impose a stay-at-home order, and its swift response is thought to have prevented 1.7 million coronavirus cases in the state.

2020-06-29.abstract: Democrats failed in their bid to shift to mail-in voting, so Texans headed to the polls for early voting amid a surge in coronavirus cases.
2020-06-29.snippet: Democrats failed in their bid to shift to mail-in voting, so Texans headed to the polls for early voting amid a surge in coronavirus cases.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — For months, Republican leaders in Texas resisted calls by Democrats to allow widespread mail-in voting, more swayed by President Trump’s concerns about mail-ballot “fraud” than by the threat the coronavirus might pose at polling places.
2020-06-29.headline_main: In Texas, Voting Reflects Partisan Split Over How to Deal With Virus

2020-06-29.abstract: Government should treat the need to reopen schools as an emergency.
2020-06-29.snippet: Government should treat the need to reopen schools as an emergency.
2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: Scott Stringer, the comptroller of New York City, has sons who are 7 and 8 years old. Over the last three months, like many parents, he’s tried to navigate what schools are optimistically calling “remote learning” while he and his wife both worked from home. It’s been, he told me, “one of the most challenging things I ever had to do in my life.”
2020-06-29.headline_main: Remote School Is a Nightmare. Few in Power Care.

2020-06-29.lead_paragraph: For years, people have been calling for John T. Edge to step down as head of the influential Southern Foodways Alliance.

2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A Francis Bacon triptych sold tonight for $84.6 million with fees at Sotheby’s inaugural digitally streamed “live” auction of contemporary and Impressionist art that replaced its postponed May evening sales in New York. A global online audience watched the company’s star auctioneer, Oliver Barker, take bids from international colleagues on screens in an empty salesroom in London specially adapted for the coronavirus pandemic.

2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: TUESDAY PUZZLE — Now this is a great tribute puzzle: It’s a crossed-word homage to someone who has fought tirelessly for the ideals of our country, instead of a Hollywood figure. It’s also a well-made debut by Zachary David Levy and, as a cherry on the sundae, it’s a sort of love letter to his wife.

2020-06-30.abstract: The actor and comedian debuts his first Netflix special, and a documentary on the persecution of L.G.B.T.Q. Chechens airs on HBO.
2020-06-30.snippet: The actor and comedian debuts his first Netflix special, and a documentary on the persecution of L.G.B.T.Q. Chechens airs on HBO.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: GEORGE LOPEZ: WE’LL DO IT FOR HALF (2020) Stream on Netflix. The actor and comedian George Lopez jumps right into race and politics in his first Netflix stand-up special. In an early bit, he jokes that Latinos should be able to choose who gets to live in the United States, arguing that deportation could be an easy way to get rid of pesky relatives. It’s no surprise that Lopez would veer toward tricky territory: The title of the special refers to a joke he made on Instagram involving a rumored bounty on President Trump. (The comment caught the attention of the Secret Service, yet Lopez clearly isn’t afraid to remind viewers of the controversy.) The rest of the show is rife with jabs at — and praises for — Latino culture. Expect some dark humor and many, many expletives.
2020-06-30.headline_main: What’s on TV Tuesday: George Lopez and ‘Welcome to Chechnya’

2020-06-30.snippet: Don’t spray them with insecticide. If you can capture the queen, the other bees will follow.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: “Get the queen inside your box,” says Samantha Winship, a 40-year-old beekeeper and urban farmer in Winston-Salem, N.C. Don’t be afraid if you find a mass of as many as 20,000 honeybees in a tree or lumped together on the side of a building. Bees swarm in search of a new home, clustering around the queen to protect her. “They’re really not interested in hurting humans,” Winship says.
2020-06-30.headline_main: How to Catch a Swarm of Bees

2020-06-30.abstract: The famously social artist was a secret homebody. His self-help book gave me permission to actually have fun at home.
2020-06-30.snippet: The famously social artist was a secret homebody. His self-help book gave me permission to actually have fun at home.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: I get sick a lot in the winter, so I spent this past January as I’ve spent many Januaries before it — in bed with a standard-issue flu. As the fever built, my mind hopscotched from one anxiety to the next. Gazing at the ceiling, I’d time-travel to the future — spring would, inevitably, be better: coffees with friends, a weekend hiking group. But when months elapsed and Covid-19 put spring on hiatus, it became clear that I, like anyone else fortunate enough to work from home, would be stuck inside. One restless weekend, close to climbing the walls, I reread “The Philosophy of Andy Warhol.”
2020-06-30.headline_main: Andy Warhol’s Secrets for Surviving Isolation

2020-06-30.abstract: Randomized controlled trials remain the gold standard, but natural experiments can help doctors who need answers now.
2020-06-30.snippet: Randomized controlled trials remain the gold standard, but natural experiments can help doctors who need answers now.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: The recent news that a decades-old steroid drug, dexamethasone, showed a one-third reduction in mortality for patients with severe Covid-19 infections has generated immense hope in the medical community. The finding came from the Recovery trial, a large randomized controlled trial in Britain.
2020-06-30.headline_main: What Coronavirus Researchers Can Learn From Economists

2020-06-30.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the pros and cons of virtue signaling — and more.
2020-06-30.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the pros and cons of virtue signaling — and more.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: I am a white college student trying to be a better racial-justice advocate in the wake of George Floyd’s death. While I have not been very politically active in the past (which I regret), recently I have attended a protest, donated a lot of my savings to bail funds and related nonprofits, called my representatives about these issues and tried to educate myself about black history and black voices. However, I have not posted on my personal social media regarding Black Lives Matter. I don’t think I have a unique perspective to add to this conversation, and I don’t like the scrutiny that comes with a social media post. I also worry that if I do post about Black Lives Matter, it would be motivated mainly by virtue signaling.
2020-06-30.headline_main: I’ve Protested for Racial Justice. Do I Have to Post on Social Media?

2020-06-30.abstract: Parents often worry older siblings will feel less loved.
2020-06-30.snippet: Parents often worry older siblings will feel less loved.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: As I looked at a familiar plus sign on a pregnancy test — standing in our bathroom covered in rubber duck toys and stackable bath cups — I felt tides of joy and sorrow. Our son had just celebrated his first birthday a few months before. As I went to tell my husband in the living room, I could also sense some pain in his smile as we both turned our eyes to our soon-to-be “firstborn.”
2020-06-30.headline_main: Mom, Can We Send the Baby Back?

2020-06-30.abstract: The debts our institutions owe to the problematic past can’t just be canceled.
2020-06-30.snippet: The debts our institutions owe to the problematic past can’t just be canceled.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: When it comes to hating Woodrow Wilson, I was an early adopter. Raised with the bland liberal history that hailed the 28th president as a visionary for championing the League of Nations, I picked up in college what was then a contrarian, mostly right-wing perspective — that many of Wilson’s legacies were disastrous, including an imperial understanding of the presidency that’s deformed our constitutional structure ever since, the messianic style in American foreign policy that gave us Vietnam and Iraq, and a solidification of Jim Crow under a scientific-racist guise.
2020-06-30.headline_main: The Ghost of Woodrow Wilson

2020-06-30.abstract: America’s neglect of older people extends to the people who care for them at home.
2020-06-30.snippet: America’s neglect of older people extends to the people who care for them at home.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Even as states reopen, Covid-19 continues to lay waste to the elderly and those who care for them. This country has a long tradition of banishing ailing seniors, and this neglect extends to the workers who help them eat and dress and nourish their minds and souls.

2020-06-30.abstract: An unreleased report commissioned by U.S. Special Operations Command found deficiencies in the military’s suicide-prevention programs for its elite troops.
2020-06-30.snippet: An unreleased report commissioned by U.S. Special Operations Command found deficiencies in the military’s suicide-prevention programs for its elite troops.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: He was one of the most elite military men in America, but his service in the Special Operations forces (S.O.F.) had taken a heavy toll. “The job I love and have committed my whole being to is creating my suicidal condition, but I’d rather die than admit to having trouble and being removed from my unit and my team,” he said often, according to someone close to him. It was impossible for The New York Times to follow up with this special operator, however, because he had died by suicide.
2020-06-30.headline_main: U.S. Commandos at Risk for Suicide: Is the Military Doing Enough?

2020-06-30.abstract: In his graphic designs, he mingled Dürer with de Chirico, Breuer with Klimt, Islamic ornament with African textiles.
2020-06-30.snippet: In his graphic designs, he mingled Dürer with de Chirico, Breuer with Klimt, Islamic ornament with African textiles.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: With the passing of Milton Glaser on Friday, his 91st birthday, New York lost a favorite son whose designs — and one in particular — radiated the vitality and multiplicity of his beloved hometown. Over seven decades, he produced an uncountable quantity of high-impact graphic imagery: first at Push Pin Studios, the countercultural and politically engaged design firm he established with Seymour Chwast and others; later at New York magazine, which he co-founded; and then as an independent designer whose experience never hardened into a signature style.
2020-06-30.headline_main: Ten Signature Images From Milton Glaser’s Eclectic Career

2020-06-30.headline_main: Don’t Ask Shaggy to Touch the Mic at a Wedding

2020-06-30.abstract: In this moment of polarization and racial justice, our critic looks back at Michael Moore’s smash documentary about the Iraq war and ‘The Notebook.’
2020-06-30.snippet: In this moment of polarization and racial justice, our critic looks back at Michael Moore’s smash documentary about the Iraq war and ‘The Notebook.’
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: The last time the country was at war with itself, Michael Moore made a movie people were mad at, too. It opened at the end of June, 16 years ago. The parent-company that released it didn’t even want to. But after weeks of controversy, the Palme d’Or at Cannes and a very good trailer, Moore’s “Fahrenheit 9/11” had become a thing, such a thing that there was no not seeing it or, since we’re talking about scorched-earth culture combat, having feelings about its right to exist even if you hadn’t. By June 27, his documentary howl against the Iraq war earned him the No. 1 movie in North America.
2020-06-30.headline_main: 2004: ‘Fahrenheit 9/11’ and a Country at War With Itself

2020-06-30.abstract: With a “multicamera global livestream” in place of its usual New York sale, the auction house tried breathing life back into a pandemic-numbed market.

He was taking seven-figure bids at a Sotheby’s sale of Impressionist, modern and contemporary art, presented as a “multicamera global livestream.”

2020-06-30.abstract: Nneji in Astoria, Queens, from a Roosevelt Island market vendor, features a menu of comfort foods.
2020-06-30.snippet: Nneji in Astoria, Queens, from a Roosevelt Island market vendor, features a menu of comfort foods.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Beatrice Ajaero grew up on Roosevelt Island, where she still lives, and has an African food and gift stall, Ibari, which she opened after obtaining a law degree and an M.B.A., in the Saturday market. Her new store, Nneji, in Astoria, Queens, has a limited menu, for takeaway, featuring West African red stew with chicken, peppery yassa with chicken, egusi melon seed and spinach soup with salmon, and a spinach and okra dish. Fonio, basmati rice and garri, which is cassava with a couscouslike texture, can be added. There are salads and occasional tagines. “I always wanted to share the tastes of my childhood,” said Ms. Ajaero, 29, whose family is Nigerian and who studied the Nigerian language Igbo, African history and political science. The name of the store means “mother” in Igbo.
2020-06-30.headline_main: New Queens Shop Serves Nigerian Food

2020-06-30.abstract: Andy de Emmony directs this by-the-book adaptation of a children’s novel about a magical creature that can grant wishes.
2020-06-30.snippet: Andy de Emmony directs this by-the-book adaptation of a children’s novel about a magical creature that can grant wishes.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: If a raggedy sand troll that grants children wishes feels like something out of a classic bedtime story, well, it is. The original conceit, by E. Nesbit, was published in 1902 as “Five Children and It,” and the children’s author Jacqueline Wilson updated the story in 2012 with “Four Children and It” to be about a blended family. Andy de Emmony’s film adapts the latter but has made the household mixed race, added teen angst and wrapped it all into a dull, family-friendly package.
2020-06-30.headline_main: ‘Four Kids and It’ Review: A Family-Friendly Magical Beach Troll

2020-06-30.abstract: After composing and arranging for big bands, he gave the world melodies like “The Shadow of Your Smile,” “Emily” and “Suicide Is Painless.”

He was 94.

2020-06-30.abstract: Standouts in dance streaming this week: “Dancing at Dusk,” Olivier Tarpaga, Mark Morris and ballet class with the Cindies.
2020-06-30.snippet: Standouts in dance streaming this week: “Dancing at Dusk,” Olivier Tarpaga, Mark Morris and ballet class with the Cindies.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Many of us have a clear image of the moment just before the world was shut down by the pandemic. A last trip, or carefree evening with friends, or a performance in a darkened theater, forever frozen in time. On March 14, 38 dancers from across Africa were in Toubab Dialaw, Senegal, at the École des Sables, rehearsing Pina Bausch’s harrowing work “The Rite of Spring” (1975). They were to perform it in Dakar later that month, before touring to Wuppertal (the home of Bausch’s company) and London. In the morning, the dancers rehearsed. In the afternoon, they were informed that all public gatherings and performances were canceled for the foreseeable future.
2020-06-30.headline_main: Before the World Shut Down, a ‘Rite of Spring’ on a Senegal Beach

2020-06-30.abstract: Born in the ’80s, the series blended cold-case investigations with paranormal legend. It was sensationalistic, a little sleazy and often a lot of fun.

2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Spawned from a series of prime-time missing-persons specials in 1985, the original “Unsolved Mysteries” laid some of the foundation for the modern true-crime phenomenon, turning regular citizens into detectives, paranormal investigators and U.F.O. experts. Unlike the regular news broadcasts of its day, “Unsolved Mysteries” urged viewers to get involved and call in with tips, leading many of the cases to be solved with the help of everyday people.

2020-06-30.abstract: Parenthood is nothing if not a constant barrage of juxtaposing feelings. My foray into motherhood wasn’t tainted by loss, it was enhanced by it.
2020-06-30.snippet: Parenthood is nothing if not a constant barrage of juxtaposing feelings. My foray into motherhood wasn’t tainted by loss, it was enhanced by it.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: I was 19 weeks pregnant when an emergency room on-call Ob-Gyn looked me in the eyes and told me that Twin A’s heart had stopped beating. Twin A — my future son — who had a name that I cannot, to this day, say out loud.
2020-06-30.headline_main: When Motherhood Means Carrying Life and Death

2020-06-30.abstract: The filmed version of Lin-Manuel Miranda’s founding-father Broadway musical arrives just in time — vital and more challenging than ever.
2020-06-30.snippet: The filmed version of Lin-Manuel Miranda’s founding-father Broadway musical arrives just in time — vital and more challenging than ever.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: The opening scenes of the filmed version of the Broadway musical “Hamilton,” which starts streaming on Disney+ on Independence Day weekend, pull you back in time to two distinct periods. The people onstage, in their breeches and brass-buttoned coats, belong to the New York of 1776. That’s when a 19-year-old freshly arrived from the Caribbean — the “bastard, immigrant, son of a whore” who shares his name with the show — makes his move and takes his shot, joining up with a squad of anti-British revolutionaries and eventually finding his way to George Washington’s right hand and the front of the $10 bill.
2020-06-30.headline_main: ‘Hamilton’ Review: You Say You Want a Revolution

2020-06-30.abstract: Reiner, the creator of “The Dick Van Dyke Show” and director of acclaimed comedies with Steve Martin and others, excelled at spotlighting the unique comic gifts of his collaborators.
2020-06-30.snippet: Reiner, the creator of “The Dick Van Dyke Show” and director of acclaimed comedies with Steve Martin and others, excelled at spotlighting the unique comic gifts of his collaborators.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: It sounds crazy to say that Carl Reiner’s death was unexpected, given that he was 98 when he passed away on Monday night. But he’s been with us so long and has cast such a long shadow over seven decades of popular culture, that it seemed that he (like his best pal Mel Brooks) might just live forever.
2020-06-30.headline_main: Carl Reiner: Where to Stream His Best Work

2020-06-30.abstract: The Covid-19 story, told in lies.
2020-06-30.snippet: The Covid-19 story, told in lies.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Thinking about the course of the Covid-19 pandemic in America, I found myself remembering Sam Smith’s history of the march to war in Iraq, told entirely in official lies. So here’s a modest attempt to do the same for the coronavirus, with statements from officials and right-wing media. I’ve grouped the statements by topic, and used chronological order within each topic.
2020-06-30.headline_main: World War C

2020-06-30.abstract: Perivoli will offer Greek classics and East River views, John Fraser reopens the North Fork Table & Inn, and more restaurant news.
2020-06-30.snippet: Perivoli will offer Greek classics and East River views, John Fraser reopens the North Fork Table & Inn, and more restaurant news.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Social distancing is not a huge challenge when your dining room is on a sprawling rooftop. Even with well-spaced tables, there are 100 seats. This restaurant, with partial views of the Queensboro Bridge and a view across the East River, has had more than one identity. Now it’s a Greek restaurant. The chef Seth Levine’s menu covers classics like crisp zucchini and eggplant chips, stuffed vine leaves, assorted spreads, grilled octopus and calamari, to be followed by plates of grilled lamb chops, chicken kebabs or lobster pasta. There’s also a swimming pool open to the public, where a snack menu is served. Admittance to both areas requires testing for Covid-19, so the hotel has set up an instant testing station for guests.
2020-06-30.headline_main: Long Island City Gets a New Rooftop Restaurant

2020-06-30.abstract: Ava DuVernay, Stanley Nelson, Sabaah Folayan and Damon Davis have all made movies that help explain our nation’s current efforts to face hundreds of years of inequity. Here’s what they said.
2020-06-30.snippet: Ava DuVernay, Stanley Nelson, Sabaah Folayan and Damon Davis have all made movies that help explain our nation’s current efforts to face hundreds of years of inequity. Here’s what they said.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: When 17-year-old Darnella Frazier filmed the police killing of George Floyd on her phone in May, her video reignited the Black Lives Matter movement and nationwide protests, even prompting one supporter to name her “the Rosa Parks of her generation.” In addition to setting off policy debates about police reform, the protests have also renewed interest in books, visual art and movies, especially documentaries about race and social justice.
2020-06-30.headline_main: We Asked Four Documentarians: How Does Film Shape the Fight for Racial Justice?

2020-06-30.abstract: “On the Line,” from the team behind the Lineup pop-up dinners, features recipes from chefs on the rise.
2020-06-30.snippet: “On the Line,” from the team behind the Lineup pop-up dinners, features recipes from chefs on the rise.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: The Lineup is an organization that sponsors dinners, open to the public, for which unheralded line cooks, chefs de cuisine and sous chefs — the heavy-lifters in the kitchen — prepare the food. Now, more than 30 of these chefs have contributed recipes for “On the Line,” a new digital fund-raising cookbook to support the cooks and organizations like the LEE Initiative Restaurant Workers Relief Program. You’ll find recipes like crispy rice with egg and romesco sauce from Christina Garruppo, a sous chef at Estela; sweet potato chicken curry from Calvin Eng, the chef de cuisine of Win Son; and honey nut roll cake with walnuts by Esther Ha, the chef de cuisine of Momofuku Ko.
2020-06-30.headline_main: This Cookbook Raises Money for Restaurant Workers

2020-06-30.abstract: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
2020-06-30.snippet: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: Sitting in beach chairs on summer sand, my mother said, “When I’m gone and pushing up daisies, on days like this, think of me.” “Don’t talk like that!” I said, not wanting to imagine her dead, in a grave, with daisies sprouting from the ground above. Twenty-one years of no longer imagining, I speak to my own children about mortality. Like I did, they resist imagining a world without their mother. Yet I hope they’ll remember my words. Recently, I’ve taken to socially distant walks in the local cemetery. There, I breathe in lilacs and remember days with my mother. — Kathy Curto
2020-06-30.headline_main: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I See the Worst of Myself in Her’

2020-06-30.abstract: The book, “Too Much and Never Enough: How My Family Created the World’s Most Dangerous Man,” is scheduled to be published late next month.
2020-06-30.snippet: The book, “Too Much and Never Enough: How My Family Created the World’s Most Dangerous Man,” is scheduled to be published late next month.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: A judge in Dutchess County, N.Y., on Tuesday temporarily blocked publication of a tell-all book by President Trump’s niece Mary L. Trump that is currently scheduled for release July 28.
2020-06-30.headline_main: New York Judge Blocks Publication of Trump Tell-All Until a July Hearing

2020-06-30.abstract: American cellular businesses will no longer be able to spend federal money on equipment from the two Chinese companies.
2020-06-30.snippet: American cellular businesses will no longer be able to spend federal money on equipment from the two Chinese companies.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Communications Commission on Tuesday designated the Chinese telecommunications firms Huawei and ZTE as national security threats, cutting them off from billions of dollars in federal broadband subsidies.
2020-06-30.headline_main: F.C.C. Designates Huawei and ZTE as National Security Threats

2020-06-30.abstract: The European aircraft giant said it didn’t expect air travel to return to pre-virus levels till perhaps 2025.
2020-06-30.snippet: The European aircraft giant said it didn’t expect air travel to return to pre-virus levels till perhaps 2025.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The coronavirus pandemic continued to wreak havoc on global aviation as the aerospace giant Airbus announced Tuesday that it would cut nearly 15,000 jobs across its global work force, the largest downsizing in the company’s history.
2020-06-30.headline_main: Airbus, Expecting Long Slump in Air Travel, Will Slash 15,000 Jobs

2020-06-30.abstract: As the civil war enters its 10th year, Syria’s economy is collapsing and the pandemic is adding to the woes. Donors pledged $7.7 billion in aid Tuesday, an amount not nearly enough to end the misery.
2020-06-30.snippet: As the civil war enters its 10th year, Syria’s economy is collapsing and the pandemic is adding to the woes. Donors pledged $7.7 billion in aid Tuesday, an amount not nearly enough to end the misery.
2020-06-30.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — As ​the long Syrian war drags into its 10th year, conditions for Syrian civilians ​are ​deteriorating​ quickly, with rapid inflation and the coronavirus pandemic adding to their​ travails​. ​On Tuesday, donors met virtually in Brussels at a conference hosted by the European Union and United Nations to try to find the money to keep the poorest Syrians alive.
2020-06-30.headline_main: At Syrian Aid Summit, a Struggle to Raise Enough to End ‘Downward Spiral’
